loans.name: Maria Desie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Maria Desie works hard to support her family.

She operates a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Maria Desie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Maria Desie has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will enable her to attain her dreams of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, représentante du groupe de crédit  Lafortune, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur,  âgée de 40 ans, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  petits objets de maquillage dames notamment (perruques, mèches, bijoux, rouge à lèvres, lotion de beauté, parfum, etc.) au marché central de Virunga. Son mari est un technicien soudeur. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses consœurs des activités de cette IMF dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  5eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires marchent positivement malgré la multitude des taxes aux quelles, elle est assujettie. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  50 perruques  et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the Lafortune credit group.  She is a courageous entrepreneur who, at age 40, is the mother of 10 children, all attending school.  She sells small beauty products for women (hairpieces, hair extensions, jewelry, lipstick, body lotions, perfumes etc.) at the central market in Virunga.  Her husband is a welding technician.

She started her business using a loan from Hekima, after hearing from her peers about the microcredit offered by Hekima in the city of Goma.  With the profits from her business, she puts some money into savings, feeds her children and pays their school fees.  She has just received her fifth loan cycle.  During that time period, she has seen her business prosper in spite of all the taxes that she has to pay.  Thanks to the loans that she has received from Hekima, she has been able to buy some important home appliances for the benefit of her family.

This new loan should help her to buy 50 hairpieces and other various items.  She would like to see her children grow up nicely.  She thanks Hekima and its partners for helping low-income women achieve independence.

loans.use: to buy 50 hairpieces and other various beauty products.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is an industrious mother.  She is married and has four children who are attending school.  

To earn a living, she established a fruit and vegetable stand near her house.  She sells meat, fruits and vegetables.  Her spouse helps her manage the business.  Because she would like to keep diversifying her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP.  With this loan, she will buy bananas, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and chicken meat to sell.  It will help her increase her profit. 

Rosel's priority is to provide the best education for her children and she will be very happy to see them become professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and chicken meat to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 51 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Juliet has a retail store right in front her house.  She is very patient in attending to her customers’ needs when they come to buy her merchandise.  From her business, she is able to give daily allowances to her children.  Her spouse is a farmer. 

Now, Juliet is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy sardines, noodles, bread, soap and shampoo to sell.  She aspires to increase both her sales and her income. 

In the future, Juliet would like to keep running her business profitably so that she will able to pay all her children's school expenses.  She is also praying for good relationships with all her customers.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, bread, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina lives in Capatan with her spouse and three children. She sells fruit and vegetables to the people in her village. She also operates a small hog business. Income from her businesses amount to about P8,000 a month. She uses the money to pay for food and household expenses. She wanted to build her hog-raising business to earn more profit. She is asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine for her hogs. In the future, Carolina hopes to have a stable source of income and have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine for hogs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 48 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Melissa works very hard to provide for them.

Melissa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Melissa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as soap and detergent. 

In the future Melissa would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en:
Honoria is 56 years old, and married with two children. They lived in Solana. To generate an income, she started a grocery store selling to the people of their village. She has been in her business for ten years. She supported her children with money from the business. Now both of her children support themselves.

Honoria is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, vinegar, cooking oil, milk and sugar. Increasing her stock will help increase sales from her business. 

Increasing her income will help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, vinegar, cooking oil, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie, 41, is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marjorie has a variety store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods such as canned goods, detergent, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Marjorie has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as canned goods, detergent, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie owns a small store in her village where she sells grocery items to generate an income for her family's daily needs. She has been doing this for four years. She earns about P4,000 each month. Rosemarie wants to improve her sales so she is borrowing P13,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. 

Rosemarie is 38 years old and has four children. All she wants is to give her children the best education. She will be very happy and proud to see all of her children become professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is an entrepreneur living in Solana with her spouse and four children. To add to her spouse's income (from farming), Luisa has been selling "ukay-ukay" (used clothes) for five years now. Though she only generates a minimal income from her business, she was very happy to provide daily allowances for her children. She is asking for a loan of P14,000 to buy more clothes, shoes, bags and caps to sell to the people in her village.

In the future, Luisa would like to keep making her business profitable to provide a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes, bags and caps to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 39 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid back 26 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mila is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Mila has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy wood, tools and equipment for her furniture-making business.

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wood, tools and equipment for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is a thirty-seven year old married lady with two children. She has a boutique in Kimana, and has been in the business for three years. She earns a monthly income of KES.10,400. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the future she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines.

Ninfa has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more drinking water to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock and selling rice.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Irshad Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Irshad Bibi is a 50-year-old married woman with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is married while the other is a laborer who earns a monthly income. Her daughters are single and live at home. They help Irshad manage the household. 
Her husband works in animal sales. He buys young animals from the animal market and sells to customers after raising them. He has been operating his business for over 10 years and has a good reputation among his customers for his knowledge about animal breeding and behavior.  
Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy a buffalo.   
Irshad is hopeful that her husband will earn better profits from his business after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  is a twenty-seven-year-old single lady with one child. She sells secondhand clothes and has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela is 58 years old and married with 3 children. Acela works very hard to provide for them.

Acela runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store.

Acela has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Acela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
Rosa   es una mujer que tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge  y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rosa vive en casa propia en el caserío Pedregal Alto del distrito de Tambogrande  del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Rosa  es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral y porcinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Rosa cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Rosa se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (porcinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde,   y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, lives with her common-law husband and their three children in their own house.  She tells us that the standard of living in her community is subsistence level, the majority of the inhabitants work on their own and raise and sell small animals as well as farm.  Rosa’s house is in Pedregal Alto village in Tambogrande district, Piura department.  This village only has basic electrical service and water drawn from a well and all the families in the village live this way.
Rosa’s business is raising, fattening and selling small animals such as: poultry and pigs and she keeps them in small corrals outside her house.  She also tells us that she sells them in local markets or to wholesale animal buyers. It's worth noting that Rosa has been in the business for 4 years and this has allowed her to develop an established customer base.
Now Rosa would like to increase her inventory for sale, by fattening and marketing the animals (pigs and poultry) since this is a good business for her area.  Thus she is requesting a new loan of 1800 new sols to buy balanced food for fattening, and to improve the corrals.  These activities will help her raise the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to fatten the animals

loans.name: Cirina

texts.en:
Cirina has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has had her business for five years. She is married and works hard to support her family.

Cirina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

In the future, Cirina would like to save money so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weavng business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has an abaca weaving business. She also earns additional income from running a sari-sari (general store) business. She and her husband have eight children. Elizabeth works hard to support her family. 

Elizabeth has requested PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials for her abaca weaving business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She is confident that her hard work will help her attain her dreams: to save money, to expand her business, and to repair the family home.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Koffiwa

texts.fr:
Koffiwa est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 26 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Koffiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des tissus, des pagnes et des produits de beauté pour tous clients dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Koffiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus, des pagnes et des produits de beauté. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Koffiwa voudrait augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffiwa is a 48-year-old woman.  She is married to an employee and has four children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest child is 26 years old.  The youngest is 8.

Koffiwa has been working as a reseller since 2008.  She sells fabrics, pagnes (colorful West African fabrics), and beauty products.  She sells in town and to all customers.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her main challenge is that she is out of stock.

Koffiwa has requested her first loan from WAGES for the purchase of fabrics, pagnes and beauty products.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Koffiwa would like to expand her business.  She says that, with the profits, she is planning to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, fabrics and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad vive con su cónyuge al sur de la ciudad y se dedica al oficio de confecciones, actividad con la que inició desde hace 10 años , cuando después de trabajar en varios talleres de la ciudad decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, para lograr plena autonomía. En la actualidad su taller funciona en una habitación de su residencia y trabaja con su hermana en la línea de ropa casual para toda la familia, así como también en la línea industrial, porque fabrica también uniformes para empresas y colegios. Su meta es lograr plena organización de su taller y tener su registro mercantil que le permita aumentar sus aspiraciones respecto a nuevos mercados. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para el cumplimiento de su de su sueño, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará una fileteadora industrial, proponiéndose darle un acabado efectivo a las prendas que elabora y mejorar sus tiempos productivos. Su razón de éxito en esta inversión es que le facilitará trabajar con otro tipo de ropa y aumentara su mercado y mejorará su proceso ahorrando tiempo, que se traduce también en dinero.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old. She lives with her spouse in the south part of town. She is a seamstress, and activity she started 10 years ago. After she had worked in various workshops in the city she decided she start her own business venture to become totally autonomous. Right now she has her workshop in her house and works with her sister in a line of casual clothing for the whole family. She also has an industrial line because she makes uniforms for businesses and schools. Her goal is to have her workshop totally organized and have her business registry which will allow her to grow her aspirations for new markets. Her biggest challenge is that her working capital isn't enough to make her dream come true. This is the reason she has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy an industrial overlock sewing machine to do better finishings on the clothing she makes and improve her production time. Her reason for success with this investment is that it will facilitate her making another type of clothing, increase her market and improve her time saving process, which will translate into money.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 43 years old, married to Sarah, and blessed with four children ages 12, 10, 7 and 4 years old. He owns a food kiosk, a business he started three years ago, that earns KES 20,000 per month. 

He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase 10 bales of baking flour and 20 litres of cooking fat. The profit he earns will assist him in educating his children. 

His dream is to see his business expand and to improve his family's well being. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To puchase 10 bales of baking flour and 20 litres of cooking fat.

loans.name: Yonasani

texts.en:
Yonasani, age 30, manages a small shop that sells motor spare parts. He lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He and his wife have two children who are both currently enrolled in school. He has been working hard to manage his small shop for the past two years.

To help expand his business, Yonasani has requested a loan in the amount of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to grow his business, generate greater profits, and increase his stock. He is confident that in the future he will be able to earn higher profits.

Yonasani is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yonasani who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to grow his business and increase his stock

loans.name: Ranya

texts.en:
Ranya, age 32, is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the family's grocery store.

Ranya and her husband have two daughters and five sons. Her husband is employed but receives a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. Therefore, for the past two years, he has also been selling groceries for additional income. This has been a profitable project, but Ranya and her husband need more support to cover the family's needs.

Ranya is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing an increased stock of the grocery items most frequently requested by his customers, such as rice, milk, and canned food. This will improve sales and considerably increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase greater stocks of popular grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente   es un hombre que tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil Viudo, vive solo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Vicente vive en casa propia en el caserío Sialupe Baca del distrito de Mochumi  del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 50 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica José  es el comercio, de ganado vacuno, además de la  crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral,  la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Vicente cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Vicente se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (vacunos y animales menores), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 Nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, ya que cuenta con sembrìo de pasto  y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 52 year old man. He is a widow and lives in a house he owns. The quality of life in the community he lives in is one of subsistence. Most residents are independent workers who are merchants and who raise small animals. Some of them are also farmers. Vicente lives in his home in the   Sialupe Baca community in the district of Mochumi in the department of Lambayeque. It has the basic service of electricity. The water come from an artesian well. He also remarks that in this community approximately 50 families live under these conditions.    

José's commercial activity is that of being a merchant. He also raises, fattens up and sells small animals such as poultry. He raises these animals in pens outside his house and sells them in the local market or to wholesale animal buyers. It's worth noting that Vicente has 10 years' experience in this activity, which has allowed him to maintain his clientele he has established in this business.
  
Right now, Vicente has decided to increase his inventory for raising and selling animals (cattle and small animals). This is a very profitable activity in the area. This is why he he is asking for a new loan of S/. 1500 nuevos soles. This will be used to buy cattle o raise, since her has some pasture and improved corrals for his animals. Over time, this will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten up.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 23, is in the business of selling second-hand clothing. She has run her business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 7,000 shillings. She and her husband have two children.

This will be Susan's first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes to offer for sale. In future, she hopes to grow her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah raises chickens to earn her living. She used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicks. These matured and she was able to offer them for sale, earning her greater profits. This helped her to pay the school fees of her children.  

She hopes to practice large-scale poultry farming in the future.  

She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicken mash and additional chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicken mash and additional chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chemicals and seeds for gardening.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario  es una mujer que tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su cónyuge  y sus  cuatro hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rosario vive en casa propia en el caserío Los Bances del distrito de Túcume del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Rosario es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, caprinos y porcinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Rosario cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Rosario se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde,   y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 49 year old woman. She is married and lives with her spouse and four children in her own home. She remarks that the quality of life in the community is that of subsistence. Most of the residents are independent workers who are merchants and who raise small animals. Some of them also are farmers. Rosario ives in her own home in the community of Los Bances in the district of Túcume in the department of Lambayeque. It has basic electricity and they get water from an artesian well. All of the families who reside there live under these conditions.  

The commercial activity Rosario does is raising and selling small animals such as poultry, goats and pigs. She raises these animals in pens outside her house, but remarks that she sells them in the local market or to wholesale animal buyers. Its worth noting that Rosario has 3 years of experience in this activity, which has allowed her to keep her established clientele in this business. 

Right now, Rosario has decided to increase her inventory for raising and selling animals (pigs, goats and poultry). This activity is very profitable in her area. This is why she is asking for a new loan for the amount of S/. 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to raise her animals and improve their pens.Over time this will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to raise animals and to improve her corrals.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 51, raises pigs to earn an income. She and her husband have five children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Sonia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Sonia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college as well as to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Obadiah has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Obadiah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like salt for resale, and will help Obadiah to generate greater profits and increase stock. Obadiah hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Obadiah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Obadiah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like salt for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She has a general store and has been in the business for fourteen years now. She earns a monthly income of 11,000 Kenya shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy items such as sugar, maize flour and matchboxes for her store. In the future she wants to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, maize flour and matchboxes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a prospective student applying for a loan to start his undergraduate work on a Bachelor of Business Science degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am Patrick, 21 years old, seeking a tuition fee loan to enable me to pursue a degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University. I am from a humble family background and needy. My elder siblings could not pursue their tertiary education because of financial constraints. My mother is not in a position to support my two siblings in secondary school, three in primary school and me. This loan will enable me to pursue my degree without any interruption due to lack of fees. I consider Strathmore University my best choice because of the high quality education offered, the discipline and facilities available for study.

My vision is to succeed in my university education and work with prospective financial institutions to participate in financial aid social programs. We wil reach more brilliant and needy students in society who have been unable to complete their studies due to financial constraints. I am personally very optimistic that my contribution to community welfare will bring a positive change in society. It is also my desire to join Kiva – not only as a borrower but also as a lender after my graduation – to ensure that this organization prospers with its activities.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will help Joseph to generate greater profits and increase more stock. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 33-year-old married man and father to one son and three daughters.

For the past two years, he has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for the family.  He needs more support to cover the family's needs and costs.

Hisham is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing the taxi, such as painting, and changing the engine and wheels. This will increase the taxi's capacity to travel from one place to another and enable Hisham to work extra hours and take more internal requests, which will help to improve the family's income.

Hisham is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his taxi to improve his income

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married lady, aged 40, who is blessed with three children aged 15, 10 and 5 months old. She sells second hand clothing and has been in operation for a period of five years, earning an income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) monthly. 

She is now servicing her third loan of 60,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to purchase six bales of second hand clothing for resale. The profits earned will be used to expand the entire business and also start a boutique shop. 

Her dream is to own a motorcycle that will be used to offer transport services, thus adding to her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase six bales of second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Makhmanazar

texts.ru: Махмадназар женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 15 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Начинал свой бизнес в 1997 году и в обороте имеет 1 голов крупного и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Данный момент имеет 6 голов крупного и 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Его бизнес идет отлично и приносит ему хорошую прибыль. В бизнесе помогает ему его брат. Махмадназар запрашивает займ для покупки 6 голов крупного рогатого скота с целю расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahmadnazar is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been buying and selling large horned cattle for more than fifteen years. He started his business 1997 with one head of large horned and two heads of small horned cattle. At this time he has six heads of large horned and twenty heads of small horned cattle. His business is doing very well and brings him a good profit. His brother helps him in the business. Mahmadnazar is asking for a loan to buy six heads of large horned cattle with a goal to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy six heads of large horned cattle.

loans.name: Rosana Yasmin

texts.es:
Rosana tiene 26 años de edad, es madre e un pequeño de 5 años de edad, por el cual ella tuvo que darse mucha fuerza para poder sacarlo adelante; vive al lado de su madre quien la apoyado mucho, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad e Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz y plátano, Rosana ha pasado por muchos inconvenientes, pero gracias a ello ha sabido salir adelante y aprender de sus errores; con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su madre Rosana logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, poco a poco fue aprendiendo y es así como su negocio ya tiene 2 años; por las mañanas a poya a su madre en la venta de desayunos y así es como también ofrece sus productos; es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha paciencia, es por ello que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, además de que siempre tiene bonitos diseños.

Rosana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como ropa para la temporada de invierno en especial cafarenas, chompas, sacos, entre otros, para damas, caballeros y niños; con esta mejora podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, con lo cual podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: Darle una buena educación a su hijo y apoyar a su madre”.
texts.en:
Rosana is 26 years old and the mother of a five-year-old, which has required a lot of fortitude.  She lives with her mother on whom she has relied heavily.  Her home is located in the city of Imperial, which is characterized by a warm climate throughout the year. Agriculture is prevalent, especially the cultivation of corn and bananas.  

Rosana has endured many difficulties but has managed to overcome and learn from her mistakes. With tremendous effort and with the help of her mother, Rosana succeeded in starting her own clothing sales business. She learned little by little and the business is now two years old. In the mornings she helps her mother sell breakfasts and at the same time offers her products for sale. She is very friendly with clients and above all is very patient; that is why she thinks she will succeed in her business. Additionally, her designs are always beautiful.

Rosana is grateful for Kiva loans. Thanks to this financial support, she can buy more merchandise for her store. This includes winter clothing such as turtlenecks, sweaters, and coats, among others, for women, men and children. With this improvement, she can have a better variety of products and increase her income, enabling her to fight toward her ultimate goal of giving her son a good education and helping her mother.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (turtlenecks, sweaters, bags, etc.)

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the southern  Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has six children. For the past 10 years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her small business, which does tailoring. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and a sewing machine for making clothes to sell, and will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her granddaughters. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another tailoring business. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosemary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials and a sewing machine for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old, married, and has two children aged two and four. He has been operating a barber shop since 2009 and has employed one person in his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage debts. This is because he has been learned financial management skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. 

Peter desires to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shaving machines and chairs.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and chairs

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en:
Nestora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. 

Nestora requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. 

She has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Nestora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years.
Elsa requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods like clothing, tupperware, slippers, and a variety of other items to sell.
In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like clothing, tupperware, slippers, and a variety of other items to sell.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers. Elisabeth has been in this business for 5 years. Elisabeth earns more income from hog raising, running a variety store, and selling used clothing. Elisabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juvylyn

texts.en: Juvylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business. Juvylyn has been in this business for 3 years. Juvylyn earns more income from food vending. Juvylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for fishing.

loans.name: Naran

texts.en: Naran, 51, makes swaddling-clothes and sells them at the bazaar. She lives with her 2 daughters in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 10 years she has been doing this business and already has gained a lot of customers who always buy swaddling-clothes from her in bulk quantities. This time she is requesting a loan to buy linens to increase her business working capital for bigger sales volume.

loans.use: To buy linens to increase her business working capital for bigger sales volume.

loans.name: Irshad Bibi's Group

texts.en: Irshad bibi is a 54-year-old married woman. Through her marriage, she has three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are getting education from a nearby school. Irshad herself is a caring woman who lives as a housewife. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  Her husband is a farmer and involved in the agriculture profession. He grows seasonal vegetables and fruits and sells in the vegetable and fruits markets. He has 10 years of experience in his work. His work requires a lot of struggle but it results in good income. Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds in larger quantity to grow products of better quality for selling. Irshad is hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, seeds, and fertilizer for her husband's agriculture business

loans.name: Tsengelmaa

texts.en: Tsengelmaa, 35, needs 1,200,000 MNT to build a garage on her plot of land. She works as an office assistant and she lives with her husband and her 2 children in their small old house which is in the ger (a Mongolian traditional yurt) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. She has been doing her job for the last 7 years and her salary does not usually meet her family's necessities. Her husband works as a plumber and also runs a taxi service with his car. The taxi service is very beneficial to increase the family's income for the necessary expenses, such as the school fees and other expenses of their children. The garage is needed to properly house her husband's car. Before, her husband used to rent space from the rental garage and it had been very expensive. Building a garage will allow the family to use their car for the taxi business and family use in the future. The loan Tsengelmaa is taking will be used to purchase the building materials to build a garage beside her house. In addition, her husband and his brother will do the labor on the garage so that it will not cost extra for hired workers.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to build a garage beside her house.

loans.name: Lely Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lely, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro ya son mayores de edad, la menor tiene 17 años y  estudia en un instituto superior. Su esposo realiza fletes en un triciclo por la localidad.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana dependiendo de cómo estén las ventas, para poder vender más deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Nuestra amiga lleva 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que gracias a esto ellos han podido salir adelante ya que es muy poco lo que gana su esposo y los gastos son muchos sobretodo con la educación de su hija, aunque ella le ayuda también con su negocio vendiendo en el centro donde estudia.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 4 años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es ver que su hija sea una muy buena profesional.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lely. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Four of them are grown and the youngest one is 17 years old and studying at an institute of higher learning. Her husband is a tricycle driver for hire in their town.

Lely is a homemaker who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door. Lely works three to four days per week depending on the level of her sales. In order to sell more, she extends credit for her products and collects payment every eight days. Lely has been in this business for three years and has done very well. As a result, she and her family have been able to move forward since her husband does not earn very much and there are many expenses, including her daughter's education. It is also helpful that Lely sells at the school where her daughter studies.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing. She has been with her Communal Bank for four years and enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dream is to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en: Nyambayar, 23, runs a computer service and a business selling spare parts. He has been running his business since last September and he started his business with working capital of 600,000 MNT. His daily earnings are about 40,000 MNT and sometimes his business is cut off for many days with no sales or service jobs. He lives with his parents, who are retired, and his younger sister in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic yurt) in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Recently, Nyambayar decided to start his second business so he could increase his business earnings in the future. The new business will be a stall in the supermarket selling casual clothes. As he plans, he needs about 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes for building the starting inventory of his new business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for building the starting inventory of his new business.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es: Benjamín se dedica  al cultivo y comercio de granos básicos como: maíz y frijoles. Cada año repite esta actividad, siembra la semilla, saca la cosecha y por ultimo pone  a la venta una  parte y la otra la deja para consumo.  Es así como se gana la vida y es importante mencionar que es su principal fuente de ingresos. El señor Benjamín  se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y muy responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él y confían en el producto que comercializa. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar este credito el cual le permita comprar los principales insumos agrícolas (semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc.) y continuar cultivando la tierra para cosechar los principales  granos básicos que le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados favorables y podrá lograr su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Benjamín is a farmer and trader of dry goods such as corn and beans. He repeats the same process each year: plant the seeds, gather the harvest, and sell a portion of his crops while the rest is kept for personal consumption. This is how he earns his living and it should be noted that his business is his main source of income. Sr. Benjamín is known as a hardworking, honest, and responsible gentleman. Many people have given him good references and have trust in the products that he sells.

Benjamín made the decision to approach Apoyo Integral for a loan so that he can buy primarily farming supplies (seeds, insecticides, compost, and other items) so that he can continue cultivating his land and harvesting the crops that pay for his daily household expenses. He trusts that Almighty God will provide him with favorable results so that he can achieve his goal of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, compost, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en: Sukhbaatar, 43, has been running a taxi for last 2 years. It is the main income source of his family currently. Before, he had many other small businesses in rural areas.  He lives with his wife and his 2 children in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt, in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. He bought his car from a car sales company and now he has to cover his car’s remaining cost. Also, he has a plan to repair his car for running his business successfully. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of his car.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his car.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en: Nasanjargal, 58, is a pensioner and widowed. Before, she worked as a conductor in the bus barn for many years. Now she lives with her 4 children in her small house in the ger (a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her monthly retirement benefit is very low and it does not usually meet her necessities. Most of her children study in college and it is quite expensive. Her house was built in early 1985 and since then it has never been renovated, so she wants to make renovations such as adding wall insulation and other kinds of repairs. She really believes that her house will become warm and more comfortable after the repairs. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase building materials to repair her old house. Her sons and daughters will do the repairs themselves.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair her old house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 24-year-old business lady. She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She has employed two people to assist her in her tasks. She is able to make good profit from her business because she has many customers due to her good reputation. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills.
Ruth hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 50-year-old single lady and a mother of one child. She sells cereals and has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to increase her stock of beans, green grams, and peas for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beans, green grams, and peas for sale.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam is a single 19-year-old Lebanese man. He’s living with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working. His father is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. Unlike others his age, Houssam started to work very early hoping to help his father with their expenses. He has been working as a plumber on a freelance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business. He notes that he’s willing to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Naranchimeg, 47, sells new sport boots. She lives with her husband and her son in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for the last 5 consecutive years and she has gained a lot of experience in her business. In the future, she has plans to expand her business. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase sport boots in large numbers to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase sport boots in large numbers to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Pierre is a 36-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and three working siblings. The whole family cooperates in order to enhance their standard of living. Pierre started to work as a hair dresser on his own in 1997. He has his loyal customers who believe in his fashionable and elegant style. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a shop for his business and some hair dressing supplies as well. He notes that this will improve his business and allow him to attract more clients. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase a shop for his business and some hair dressing supplies as well.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es:
Blanca Marina tiene 38 años de edad es divorciada tiene 5  hijos, vive con la madre y los hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Blanca Marina se dedica a la cría de animales cómo de pollos, cerdos, además se dedica a la venta de carne asada, tortillas. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo cerdos y comprar carne para el negocio. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales y la carne que necesita para el negocio.
La compra lo hará en Chillanes. El sueño es poder construir la vivienda y poder dar el estudio a los hijos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con la familia, ir de paseo, ver televisión y disfrutar de las festividades de santa Rita, La Merced y el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina is 38 years old, divorced, and has five children. She and her children live with her mother in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Blanca Marina raises animals, such as pigs and chickens. She also sells roasted meats and tortillas. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy animals, such as pigs, and meat for her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy animals and meat that she needs for her business. Her purchases are conducted in Chillanes. Blanca dreams of building a home and providing an education for her children. The challenges she faces include the lack of money to cover her household necessities.

In her free time, Blanca Marina enjoys spending time with her family by going on walks, watching television, and enjoying the Santa Rita, La Merced, and Carnival festivals.

loans.use: to buy meats for her food business and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 33-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and two siblings, one of whom is working. Her father is their main source of income and trying his best to be as helpful as he can. Rima started her own job from her home. She has been working as a beautician since 2009. She has her loyal customers, and she is happy with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added beauty products for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been operating the business for two years and has employed two people. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management skills which has helped her improve her business. Beatrice hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Marìa Aurora

texts.es:
María   es una mujer que tiene 52  años de edad, de estado civil  casada,  vive con su hijo y su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío Las Adelinas del distrito de Cayaltì del  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 18 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende su leche en el mercado de Cayalti; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5  has de cultivo de maíz  lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de leche, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/.3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de una mototaxi para poder trasladar su producto (leche) y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia
texts.en:
María  is a 52 year old married woman who lives with her son and spouse in their own home.  The quality of life in the community is one of subsistence.  The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in the trade and care of small animals and some also work in agriculture.  Maria lives in the farm town Las Adelinas in the Cayaltì district in the department of Piura.  She only has basic electricity.  It is also worth mentioning that in this farm area, approximately 120 families live under these conditions.

Maria works in the commercial activity of raising and vaccinating livestock, selling milk and raising fowl.  These animals are raised outside of her house in external corrals.  Additionally, Maria has 18 years of experience in this line of work, which has allowed her to maintain an established clientele in her business.  She sells her milk at Cayalti market. Her spouse also works his small farm where he has cultivated 1.5 [has] of corn which is phenologically healthy.  Her domestic partner arduously supports her in the activities he does, and there is a good familial relationship between them.  

Currently, Maria has set the goal of expanding her inventory in the raising [of livestock] and the selling of milk.  The reason for this is that it is a very profitable activity in this area.  Thus, she is asking for a new loan for a total of S/.3000 nuevos soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle-taxi to transport products (milk) and to repair the corrals for her animals.  In time this will allow her to better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for her business and to repair her livestock corrals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca  es una mujer que tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge  y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Francisca vive en casa propia en el caserío Ayar Auca  del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Francisca es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Francisca cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Francisca se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (ovinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde,   y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 38-year-old woman who is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and their three children in their own house. It is said that the quality of life in the community is subsistence level. The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in commerce and raising small animals, and some of them also work in agriculture. Francisca lives in her own house in the village of Ayar Auca in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. In addition, she has only basic electrical service, and water is provided through an artesian well. All the families that live there also live under these conditions.

Francisca's commercial activity is raising, fattening, and selling small animals such as barnyard fowl and sheep. She raises these animals in pens outside her home. Nevertheless, she mentions that she sells these animals in the local market or to wholesale buyers of animals. It should be emphasized that Francisca has 8 years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain already established customers in this business.

Now Francisca has proposed increasing her inventory with regard to the fattening and sale of animals (sheep and barnyard fowl), since it is a very profitable business in this area. It is because of these circumstances that she is applying to Edpyme Alternative for a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN, which will be destined for the purchase of balanced feed to fatten the animals and improvements in their corrals. In time this will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and improve their pens.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and five siblings. Hasan's father is the one responsible for his wife and children’s needs. As for Hasan, his hobby was to make wood carvings until he decided to make it his own business. He opened his own shop in 2005 and is looking forward to making better designs. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his business. He notes that this will increase his productivity and thus his sales. In the future, he plans to expand his business and make his own exhibits.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his business.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a prospective student applying for a loan to start work on a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications at Strathmore University and this is his story:

My name is Sammy. I am from Nairobi, Kenya. I was born second in a family of four siblings including two brothers and two sisters: an elder sister named Berryl; a younger sister called Tinna, currently in her third form in secondary school; and Gabriel, the last born of the family, who is a standard 8 candidate at primary school.

I chose Strathmore University because I believe that it is the institution that will offer me the best opportunity for quality education. I draw inspiration from my elder sister, who is an alumnus of the University; her colleagues who went to Strathmore with her, and my former classmates who are currently studying at Strathmore. They motivated me to seek admission to Strathmore University, and I am so grateful to God that I was granted entrance and will therefore commence my first year of study on June 25, 2012.

I am taking out this Kiva loan to fund my degree course through University. This is because my family is currently unable to pool enough resources to see me through my degree. Even though Strathmore University seems an expensive option given my family’s financial status, I do believe that education is a worthy and noble investment in one’s future, and not just an expense as some may perceive. 

My father, the family’s sole breadwinner, was rendered jobless along with thousands of others when his factory was shut down three years ago and placed under receivership. He now tries his hand at farming. He has established a small tree seedling nursery. He uses the returns to look after the family’s welfare and contribute to my siblings' school fees. My mother, who has been a hairdresser for almost 15 years now, uses her meager earnings to feed the family. My elder sister Berryl, who is currently juggling school and work, is the one who helped my parents put me through secondary school. She is also financing my younger siblings’ education and paying her own fees for a degree course. Her finances are stretched far too thin to pay for my university fees. This has left me with a Kiva loan as my only option of getting a chance to study at university.

At Strathmore, I wish to pursue a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications, which will enable me to achieve my dream career in the field of Information Technology. This is something that has kept me motivated and inspired me to put in the effort needed to excel in my secondary school education. I want to pursue a leading career in the ICT sector after I graduate from my course, and I hope to make a positive contribution to the development of Kenya. It is through ICT that Kenya can follow the path toward attaining its visions and goals. I also hope that I will be able to further my education and attain a Master's in the same field. I hope to also assist my younger siblings (and anybody else I can) to get the best education so that they may also have a successful and bright future. Furthermore, I am so grateful to the Kiva program as it seeks to help put needy students through school, ultimately leading the way toward raising a nation with fulfilled dreams – a nation which is successful, grateful, charitable and unified.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Telecommunications at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Hugo Guillermo

texts.es:
Hugo Guillermo tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Hugo Guillermo es maestro soldador. 
Solicita el crédito para  comprar ganado. Con el dinero podrá comprar dos ganados vacunos.  La compra lo hará en Machachi. El sueño es dar la educación a los hijos, y aumentar el ganado.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades del ganado. En el tiempo libre le gusta el deporte y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Hugo Guillermo is 37 years old and is married with four children. He lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes province of Bolívar.

Hugo Guillermo is a master welder. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase cattle. With the loan money he will be able to purchase two beef cattle in Machachi. 

His dream is to provide education for his children and to increase his cattle herd. Cattle diseases are one of the challenges he faces. In his free time, Hugo Guillermo likes sports and enjoying carnival activities.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They have five children, four of whom are working and the other one is still attending school.  Her husband is the main source of income in the family and has big responsibilities to take care of. As for Nada, she has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past twenty-three years; she has her own shop where she serves all the neighboring villages. Today, she’s requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her shop to be able to carry on her work properly. In the future, she plans to enhance her work and buy some land where she can cultivate all kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her shop to be able to carry on her work properly

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and four siblings, who are all working. His father and siblings strive to work under pressure in order to have a good way of living. And after many years of experience as a carpenter, Jaafar decided to open his own carpentry business in 2004. He’s a reputable man who has gained a fair number of loyal customers despite his young age. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He notes that this will improve his business and thus boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work

loans.name: Candelario Noe

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 22 años de edad, tiene una compañera de vida. Él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura junto con su papá, desde hace 6 años que se dedica a la ganadería. Con su propio esfuerzo compro una vaca y de esa vaca hoy tiene 8 más.  

Para comprar el concentrado para las vacas, se traslada a la ciudad que esta ha veinticinco minutos a pie, después aborda un autobús que tarda media hora. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Candelario es para comprar una vaca parida y un toro, por que tiene 8 vacas y no tiene toro y son 98,000 metros cuadrados de terreno que quiere aprovecharlo al igual que su juventud. 

Al realizar el financiamiento se le mejorara en todos los ámbitos, ya que candelario manifiesta que dispondrá del sustento diario por medio de las vacas y de esa manera ofrecerá a su esposa una vida digna. 

Él menciona que si Dios lo bendice planea arreglar adecuadamente el terreno y tener tres hijos con su esposa y quiere estar preparado cuando eso pase, tanto económicamente como emocional para no tener problemas a futuro.
texts.en:
Candelario is 22 years old and is in a relationship. He has worked for the past 6 years with his father in agriculture and cattle-raising. By his own means he bought a cow and from that cow he now has 8 more. To purchase the cow feed, he travels 25 minutes by foot to the city and then takes a 30-minute bus ride. 

Candelario is requesting this loan to purchase a calved cow and a bull. He has 8 cows and no bull, and he wants to take advantage of both his youth and his 98,000 square meters of land.

Upon receiving this funding, things will improve for Candelario in all aspects. He states that with these cows he will provide daily food and will thus offer his wife a decent life.  

Candelario mentions that with God's blessing he plans to adequately fix the land and have three children with his wife. He wants to be prepared when this happens, both economically and emotionally, to avoid problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a calved cow and a bull.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Naranchimeg, 30, works as a janitor in the public theater. She lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her monthly salary usually does not cover her necessities and she wants to start saving for her family. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to plant vegetables on her plot of land. Before, she took a loan to run a retail business and repaid her loan successfully on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant vegetables on her plot of land.

loans.name: Tabitha M.

texts.en:
Tabitha is 27 years old, from Nakuru and is married with one daughter who is 7 years old.

Tabitha has a hotel business that she has been doing for the past 4 years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy chairs, tables and also cooking items like cooking fat, sugar etc.

She hopes to expand her hotel business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is 46 years old, married and has five children.  He has been operating a tailoring business for over ten years.  He has benefited from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills. This has helped him in running his business.  His desire is to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with six children. She lives in Ntambessi, Cameroon. She lives with her entire family in a three-bedroom house. She has overcome difficulties like her daughter's sickness, which was for four years, difficulties in paying her rent, and she went as far as cooking with no cooking oil.

This will be the 7th time Anna is benefiting from a loan from GHAPE.  Anna has been in GHAPE since August 2002 and has been very successful in past businesses. She uses her house for the business and this keeps her from paying rent elsewhere.

Anna plans to buy firewood, decoration materials and to pay for transportation. She says that this business will help the community in that they will get firewood very cheap from her.

She intends to use the proceeds of this business to pay her children's school fees, buy some basic needs for the family, and save some with the credit union.

loans.use: to pay for firewood, transportation and decoration materials

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en: Elvita, 51 years old, is from the village of Luna, province of Isabela. A hardworking and loving mother of three grown children, she is engaged in making rice cake and other pastries. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional raw materials that she can use to make rice cake and other pastries to sell in the community. In the future, Elvita hopes that she can expand her business so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, coconut and beverages for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
