loans.use: pay school fees for herself

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a 32-year-old married mother of 2 children residing for over five years in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  Her source of revenue is through the operation of a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoos, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: buy items to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a mother of 5 children and she lives in Hioma, Uganda.  She has been operating a restaurant for over six years and this has enabled her to pay school fees for her children.  She faces challenges in price fluctuations and inflation. Her family goal is to educate her children and upgrade her restaurant so as to attract middle class customers. Fatuma intends to use the loan to purchase better quality seats and a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.use: buy seats and a fridge for her restaurant

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from Maquilao in Tangub City.  She is 52 years old, married and has one grown child.  Lydia sells fish that she raises in her fishpond for a living.  She has been active in this business for 16 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC.  She is requesting a loan of 15,600 PHP in order to repair a fishing boat that is used in her business.  Lydia plans to put the additional revenue generated from the business toward improving the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat that is used in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is 34 years old. Josephine is a widow and has four children. 

To earn a living, Josephine plants, harvests and sells bananas.  Josephine has been active in her business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.  

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC.  Josephine is requesting a loan of 16,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase chemicals for use on the farm.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to be used on her farm.

loans.name: Angel Rolando

texts.es:
ANGEL ROLANDO  tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

ANGEL ROLANDO  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, mora y arveja. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios cómo abonos, urea, líquidos para fumigar, insecticidas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para mejorar los cultivos. El sueño es culminar su carrera y egresar cómo ingeniero y también incrementar los sembríos de mora para poder tener mejores ingresos. L
os desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte cómo el indor, bolly y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Rolando is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Angel Rolando is a farmer who grows corn, blackberries, and peas. He is requesting a loan to buy needed supplies such as compost, urea, liquids for fumigation, and insecticides. With the help of this loan, he will be able to fertilize and improve his crops. His dream is to finish his degree so that he can become an engineer. He also wants to increase his blackberry production so that he can generate more income. The challenges he faces include dealing with bad weather.

In his free time, Angel Rolando enjoys playing sports (indoor soccer and volleyball) and participating in the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, liquids for fumigation, and insecticides.

loans.name: Elipio

texts.es:
Elipio tiene 61 años, es un hombre muy responsable que vive en compañía de su hija, Jessica, en la localidad de Pantipata. 

Hace 7 años falleció su esposa, desde ese entonces se siente triste, pero sabe que tiene que continuar con su vida, por su hija, el único familiar que le queda. Su economía se centra en la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos son; trigo, habas, olluco y papa, los que cuida con mucho amor y esmero, pues sabe que depende de sus cuidados para que resultado que obtenga sea el mejor. Pero como es un hombre de campo, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino, los que engorda para luego vender a los carniceros. Gracias a su esfuerzo, y él de su esposa, logró adquirir varios terrenos agrícolas, los cuales comparte con su hija, ya que le enseñó este moble oficio.

Él pertenece al grupo “Agupata” y éste es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, pues obtiene el apoyo económico que necesita. 

Elipio invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales para poder aumentar su ganado y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elipio, 61, is a very responsible man who lives with his daughter, Jessica, in the town of Pantipata.  His wife died seven years ago.  He has been sad since then but he knows that he has to go on with his life because of his daughter, the only family he has left.

His finances revolve around agriculture.  His main crops are wheat, broad beans, "olluco" [a tuber], and potatoes.  He looks after them with a lot of love and care because he knows they depend on his care to get the best results.  Since he is a rural man, he also raises cattle and sheep, which he fattens for later sale to the butchers.  Thanks to his effort and that of his wife, he managed to acquire several plots of cropland, which he shares with his daughter because he taught her this noble job.

He belongs to the Agupata group and this is the third loan he has had with MFP, for which he feels fulfilled because he gets the economic support he needs.

Elipio will invest the requested money in buying animals to be able to increase his livestock and consequently his profits.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is 46 years old.  Fatima is married and has two children. 

To earn a living, Fatima makes and sells food such as snack foods and other delicacies in the local community.  Fatima has been active in her business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Fatima joined GDMPC.  Fatima is requesting a new loan of 18,600 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the snack foods and delicacies she sells.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a forty-year-old married woman, and the mother of six children. Since 2004, she has worked selling used clothes and electronic household appliances. Rima is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation, she puts a huge effort into helping her husband to cover their expenses and make their living. Rima is well known in the region with her wide business talent, she expanded her business a lot, and is working on making necessary decorations to give each product its suitable place.

Rima has been a partner of Al Majmoua and Kiva for nine loan cycles. Her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business, and at the same time her family's living standards. Today, Rima is applying for a loan for the same purpose which is to increase the clothes that she has to sell, especially her spring and summer collection. She is sure it will bring benefit to her family and business.

loans.use: To increase the spring and summer clothes that she has to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is fifty-one years old and married with three children. She has a job working for an institution. In addition, she has been running a beverage warehouse from her home for 30 years. She is mostly a wholesale distributor but on Sundays she also sells some products through retail. A loan will help Cristina purchase more soda and beer. She says that Coca Cola is her most popular product. In the future, she would like to expand her operations to another locale.

Cristina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda for wholesale distribution.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.en:
Ayde has been selling replacement parts for heavy vehicles for about fifteen years. She is a single mother and is thirty-five years old. She is raising four children, the oldest of which is in university. Her youngest two children are in primary school. A loan will help Ayde purchase more merchandise such as brake drums, front and rear springs, and tires. Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor.

Ayde is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy car replacement parts such as brake drums, front and rear springs, and tires.

loans.name: Shielenn Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a twenty-three-year-old student completing her degree in administration. She has just one more year of classes to finish. In order to support her studies, she continues selling cosmetics from catalogs to friends, family, and neighbors. A loan will help her buy more cosmetics. Additionally, she wants to use part of the loan to bring clothes from Lima to sell. Her dream is to open a hotel after she finishes her education.

Pamela is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, as well as clothes from Lima.

loans.name: Icyerekezo Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe Icyerekezo. Le nom du groupe signifie «Vision». Il a 35 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 3 mois à 9 ans, dont 1  scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Etienne est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Etienne voudrait devenir le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de, payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne is a member of the group Icyerekezo. The group’s name means “Vision”. Etienne is 35 years old, married, and he has four children aged 3 months to 9 years old, one of them in school. He attended 6 years of primary school.

Etienne is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.  

His business growth strategy is to obtain additional loans in order to bolster his activities. In the coming years, Etienne hopes to become the leading rice farmer in his region. He plans to use his profits to provide for his children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 30 years old and a single mother of two young children.  One is four years old and the other is five months old.  Lucila has a store where she sells replacement parts for heavy vehicles.  She has been working in this job for five years.  Previously, she learned the trade by working for another person in the same business. 

A loan will help Lucila buy more products to sell, including transmissions, brake drums, stabilizers and supports.  Her dream is to expand her business by adding a hardware supply section to her store.

Lucila is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru.  The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts such as transmissions, brake drums, stabilizers and supports.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been running a small grocery store from her house for many years. As a long time associate of Asociación Arariwa, she also hosts her village bank’s monthly meetings in her home. At forty-nine years old, Esther has four children, two of whom have families and two who are completing their university education. A loan will help Esther buy more merchandise such as sugar, rice, and sodas. Her dream is to open a mini-market.

Esther is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sugar, rice and sodas.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a forty-eight-year-old married man, and a father of five children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2005, and his business is going just fine especially during the high season in the summer when there are tourists. His business is his source of livelihood, which is why he has to take good care of it. 

Unfortunately his car's engine broke and he needs additional cash to buy a new engine. This is why he applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and he's sure that it will help his business and family a lot.

loans.use: To change his car's engine.

loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.en:
Ruth Meri is twenty-six years old and now works overseeing the administration of her sister’s bar / nightclub, though in the past she focused on buying and selling fruit. Ruth Meri has completed her degree in tourism and would like to pursue a second degree in accounting. A loan will help her pay for the university tuition. In total, it will take three years to complete the program. Ruth Meri says that in the future she would like to open her own nightclub.

Ruth Meri is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is thirty-six years old, married, and a father of two children. For the last year, he has earned a living by selling charcoal in wholesale in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his second loan of KES 100,000, to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his children's school fees and continue supporting his family. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is forty-three years old and has three children with her partner. For nine years, she has run a business in the market selling beans, spices, and dry goods such as chuño (dried potatoes). A loan will help her buy more merchandise from Huancaro and other locations outside of Cusco. Her dream is to open her own store, because right now she shares a space with 35 other associates in the market.

Rosa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy beans, spices and dry goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, présidente du groupe de crédit  Pacifique, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur,  âgée de 46 ans, mère de 9 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  pagnes au marché communal de Nyabushongo. Son mari est chômeur depuis plusieurs années. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses pairs des activités de cette IMF dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  5eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires évoluent positivement. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé nouveaux investissements importants pour sa famille (chaises, poste radio, etc.). Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  9 coupes de pagnes et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et accroitre son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client is the president of the loan group Pacifique. A brave and tireless entrepreneur, she is a 46-year-old mother of nine children who all go to school. She sells pagnes at the community market of Nyabushongo. Her husband has been unemployed for several years.  

She started her business with loans obtained from Hekima after learning about the MFI’s activities in the city of Goma through her peers. Her profits help to boost her savings, and to pay for food and for her children’s tuition. 

Past loans have allowed her to acquire various household items for her family (chairs, radio, etc.). With her business showing growth throughout the last cycle, she has applied for her 5th loan. She will use this new loan to purchase nine pieces of pagnes and various other items. 

She wants to see her children grow up comfortably, and plans to expand her business. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI and its partners for helping low-income women to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase nine pieces of pagnes and various other items.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bertha Olivia

texts.es:
Bertha se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una buena educación. Anteriormente Bertha se dedicaba a la venta de pollos asados, pero debido a circunstancias adversas a su voluntad se vio en la obligación de cerrar su negocio y dejarlo a un lado; ahora, luego de 2 meses de haber cerrado su negocio, se le ha presentado la oportunidad de reabrir su venta de pollos asados y no quiere desperdiciar esta oportunidad para nuevamente generar ingresos con los cuales pueda contribuir al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar insumos para la venta de pollos asados y así reabrir su negocio.
De esta manera generará nuevamente los ingresos con los cuales su familia pueda tener mejores condiciones económicas y así poco a poco su familia irá progresando. Además, Bertha espera que sus hijos salgan adelante y sigan superando las grandes adversidades que le presenta la vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is married and has 4 children for whom she has always wanted to provide a high quality of life and access to good education.  Previously Bertha sold roast chicken, but due to circumstances against her wishes, she found herself obligated to close her business and leave it for a while.  Now, two months after closing the business, she has been presented with the opportunity to re-open and begin selling roast chicken again.  She doesn't want to miss out on this opportunity to earn an income which she will use to contribute to paying her household expenses.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan so that she can buy supplies and re-open her roast chicken business.

From this loan, Bertha will again be able to earn an income that will provide better economic conditions for her family.  Little by little, her family's situation will improve.  Furthermore, Bertha hopes that her children will get ahead and continue to overcome the difficulties that life presents.

loans.use: to buy for supplies for the sale of roast chicken and to re-open her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy alegre. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo, desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo cuidan de 2 de ellos. Su casa, que es propia, está ubicada en el anexo de San Pedro de Saño.  

Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura. Sus sembríos constan de maíz y papa; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero para garantizar la calidad de sus cosechas, ya que en temporada de recolección los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos para negociar los productos. La ayuda de su esposo es vital, pues juntos toman decisiones para afrontar las dificultades; como la falta de peones o las plagas que azotan sus cultivos. Como es una mujer del campo, también se dedica a la ganadería; cría vacas que le brindan la leche que después vende a los pobladores de su localidad, y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Para el futuro, Rosa desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, porque tiene planes de seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “San Pedro” y éste es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Rosa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old. She is a very happy woman. She lives with her husband, Raúl, whom she has been married to for the past 20 years. They have three children together, but only two of them are still living at home. Their house, which they own, is located in the San Pedro of Saño annex.

Her principal income generating activity is farming. She has crops of corn and potatoes, which she cares for well so that she can guarantee a good harvest. Each year during harvest the same purchasers come to her land to negotiate a price for her products. The support of her husband is vital; they make decisions together to work past difficulties they are faced with, like lack of laborers or pests that are affecting their crops. She also raises farm animals; she raises cows which provide milk that she later sells to other community members. She also has a small grocery store in her house. In the future, Rosa wants to buy more agricultural land, because she would like to be able to pant larger crops.   

She belongs to the communal bank group "San Pedro" and this is the 8th loan she has taken out with MFP. She promises, once again, to make the payments on time. She is thankful to be a part of her communal bank because the members are responsible and a united group. 

Rosa will invest the money that she has requested to buy supplies to restock her store.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina runs a bar and restaurant serving fried pork in the Santiago neighborhood of Cusco. She is forty-seven years old and single, and has run this business for over a year now. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more beer and soft drinks for her restaurant. She says that the high season begins after Mother’s Day, and she wants to be ready for an increase in sales. Her dream is to open up 2-3 other branches of her restaurant.

Josefina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepción is forty years old and lives with partner and two children. She dedicates herself to various activities. Part of the time, she runs a business selling chicha (a fermented corn beverage popular in Peru). She also sells perfumes and cosmetics from a catalog. 

In addition, Concepcion offers telephone services, both from a fixed site and as an ambulatory vendor. This means that she carries mobile phones with her and charges customers a fixed price in order to make calls. She has had this work for four years, and is requesting a loan in order to buy more mobile phones, as well as to purchase cakes and pastries to serve with her chicha. Concepción dreams of opening up a restaurant in the future.

Concepción is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and to purchase cakes and pastries to serve with her chicha.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is an artisan who has been producing handcrafted lamps for the last five years. Sometimes she hires employees to help her, but mostly she runs the business with the help of her husband. A loan will help Ernestina purchase more materials such as leather and fabric to create the lamps. Her dream is to export her products to the United States.

Ernestina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy material such as leather and fabric to construct her lamps.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana has multiple businesses. Sometimes she sells fruit and other times she sells clothing and shoes at the local fair. She is thirty-eight years old and lives with her two children and partner. She says she has been doing this work for a long time, and is requesting a loan to bring more merchandise (shoes and clothing) from Arequipa. She purchases her fruit locally in Cusco. Her dream is to have her own storefront.

Roxana is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing from Arequipa.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is thirty-four years old, married, and a father of two children. For the last year, he has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi town. He makes a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000, to buy additional stock such as skirts, trousers and shirts to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees as well as continue supporting his family.

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business with the aim of owning a boutique soon so that he can to give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as skirts, trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.en:
Yesenia Paulina, a 21-year-old student of communication sciences, has one more year to finish her degree which she finances both by selling products from a cosmetics catalog and working as a private tutor.

Right now she is requesting a loan to build up an inventory of products that she will sell to her clients at the normal price. For example, one of her most popular products normally costs 30 soles but is temporarily available for just 18 soles. A loan will help Yesenia Paulina to purchase products such as perfumes, lipsticks, eyeliners, creams and hand lotions.

Yesenia Paulina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to stock her business with beauty products.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.en:
Yaneth is twenty-two years old and works as a wholesale distributor of grains. She has been doing this work at a local market for four years. In addition she dedicates part of her time to studying cosmetology. Yaneth would like a loan to purchase more grains such as wheat, potatoes, and barley. She would like to run a large wholesale grain business in the future, expanding to other markets outside of Cusco.

Yaneth is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grains such as wheat, potatoes, and barley.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
Julio Cesar is twenty-three years old and continues working in the transportation business. He has been running a tire shop for four years, where he offers tires for all types of vehicles. A loan will help him purchase more tires. Julio Cesar has a degree in accounting, which helps him run his business effectively. Recently, Julio Cesar was injured in a carjacking incident and so is not presently driving a taxi.

Julio Cesar is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tires for his tire shop.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Siquirritos Group

texts.es:
Annia es la secretaria de Banco Mujer Siquirritos, es una mujer muy joven, profesional, y muy trabajadora. Con 30 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente de pintor, y su ingreso es muy bajo, por eso Annia siempre ha buscado como ayudar a la economía de su familia desarrollando actividades comerciales, vende de forma ambulante ropa, sandalias, carteras, bolsos y bisutería. 
Este es el tercer crédito que solicita, y los anteriores han sido de gran ayuda para invertir en capital de trabajo y consolidar su negocio. 
Es importante resaltar que Annia es maestra,  tiene un bachiller universitario, y es graduada en enseñanza de I y II segundo ciclo,  sin embargo no ha logrado conseguir trabajo fijo en el sistema de educación nacional, y además de da cuenta que con su negocio bien administrado y con mucho esfuerzo le puede generar un buen ingreso. 
Sus metas es ejercer su profesión y tener un trabajo fijo y estable, pero también llegar a tener una tienda donde ofrezca todos los productos que actualmente vende. Con ellos darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir apoyando a su esposo en la parte económica. 
Junto a Annia hay 7 señoras más que se dedican a actividades comerciales y de servicios.
texts.en:
Annia is the secretary of the group called Banco Mujer Siquirritos.  She is a young woman, professional and a hard-worker.  At 30 years old, she is married and the mother of 4 children, all minors.  Her husband occasionally works as a painter and his income is very low.  Because of this, Annia has always looked for ways to help improve the family's financial situation.  She started a business as a street vendor and sells clothes, shoes, wallets, purses, and jewelry.

This is the third loan she has asked for and the previous loans have helped her invest in capital and strengthen her business.

It's important to highlight that Annia is a teacher with a Bachelor's degree for teaching both primary and secondary school.  However, she has not been successful in finding steady work in the national education system.  Therefore, she has realized that by managing her business well and with a lot of work, she can earn a good income.

Her goals are to practice her profession and to have steady and stable work, but also to have a store that offers all of the products she currently sells.  By doing this, she can improve her family's quality of life and continue supporting her husband with the household expenses.  

Besides Annia there are 7 other women that are also dedicated to commercial activities and services in this group.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing, shoes, purses, wallets and jewelry.

loans.name: Sheikha

texts.en:
Sheikha is fifty-eight years old, and is a fishmonger in Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last one year successfully. 

This marks her first loan after she was recently introduced to KADET Ltd. She plans to use the loan to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch and prawns to supply to her customers. 

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and repay her loan. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch and prawns.

loans.name: Kerambo

texts.en:
Kerambo is a forty-year-old vegetable-seller in Mombasa. He is married and has been selling vegetables for the past ten years with great success. 

This is his second business loan from KADET Ltd. He hopes to purchase more tomatoes, onions and assorted vegetables to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to build his own permanent house. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions and assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty-four. He is single and lives with six family members who two of them work.

Ali has owned a store since 2005, selling women clothing, accessories and cosmetics. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2500 as “Youth loan” in order to redecorate his store and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his store and to add more goods.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 42-year-old tailor in Kilifi. She is a married mother of three and has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last 20 years with great success.  This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread, and more cloth materials. 
She will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business and repay her loan. She hopes to have a prosperous life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread, and more cloth materials.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-nine years old. Delia is married and has two children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a gardening business venture. Delia has been in her business for ten years and earns PHP 5,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Delia joined GDMPC. Delia is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to finance land preparation and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to finance land preparation and to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is from Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is thirty-two years old and single. To make a living, Ely owns and operates a business venture in the services sector offering transportation services. Ely has been engaged in his business for four years and earns PHP 3,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Ely joined GDMPC. Ely is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.en:
Amadeo resides in Pallua with his wife and two children. He had a small business selling home products and electronic load to the people in his village. He had been doing this for over three years now. His income goes for meals and daily school allowances. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more soap, fabric conditioners, and electronic load to sell. In the future, he hopes to make the business more profitable in order to pay his children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy more soap, fabric conditioners, and electronic load to sell.

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa is a forty-nine-year-old married man who has two sons and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. The area lacks basic infrastructure. His two sons are very independent, the elder one is student at local university, and other one works in Korea with a labor contract. 

Amarsanaa has been operating a public transportation service business since 2000 with special help from his spouse Gantsetseg. When they first began their business they bought a minivan which was produced in 1995. After nine years, in 2009, he changed the old van for a new one which was produced in 2001. 

Mostly his customers really like to use very nicely colored, clean and safe minivan. So he is requesting a 2.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to restore his minivan’s color and purchase some necessary tools in order to attract more customers as well.

loans.use: to restore his minivan's color and purchase some tools.

loans.name: Mukhambet

texts.ru: Мухамбет – лидер группы Терек -3, объединяющей еще двух женщин – участниц. Мухабету 43 года, женат,  имеет 5 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1992 году Мухамбет начал  заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 2,500 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мухамбет обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Мухамбет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Mukhambet is a leader of the group Terek 3 which unites two more women members. Mukhambet is 43 years old, he is married and has five children. As a source of income for his family Mukhambet started doing animal husbandry since 1992. The business which was started with a capital of 2,500 som (KGS) now brings around 10,000 som a month from the sale of milk and dairy products. With the goal to further grow his business Mukhambet has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. He plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jerónimo Baltazar

texts.es: Jerónimo Baltazar de 32  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos dos de los  cuales se encuentran estudiando.   Jerónimo  se dedica al comercio de pan dulce, francés, galletas, y otros que transporta en su vehículo haciendo la venta.   Con grades esfuerzos ha logrado mantener activo su negocio por más de 13 años.  Él  se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y sobre todo emprendedor.  Jerónimo tiene muchas ideas de negocio las cuales poco a poco va poniendo en marcha.  Su sueño es seguir manteniendo activo su negocio por mucho tiempo por lo que siempre trata de mantenerse un paso adelante de la competencia y es así como ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos los cuales manifiestan estar satisfechos con el servicio prestado por Jerónimo.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este préstamo  a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la comprar de variedad de pan dulce y francés con el fin de incrementar inventario de tal forma que pueda abastecer a una mayor demanda de mercado.  De esta manera espera mejorar el servicio a los clientes con el objetivo de mejorar su nivel de ventas como de ingresos de tal forma que poco a poco pueda ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jerónimo Baltazar is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his family, which consists of his life companion and their three children. Two of his children are currently studying. Jerónimo sells sweet bread, French bread, cookies, and other baked goods directly from the vehicle used to transport his merchandise. With great effort, he has been able to stay active in his business for more than 13 years. He is known as a gentleman who is hardworking, responsible, and most of all, enterprising.

Jerónimo has several ideas for his business that are gradually being implemented. His dream is to continue an active business for a long time so that he can stay ahead of the competition. This has enabled him to earn the trust of his neighbors who are pleased with the service that he provides. Jerónimo decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can invest in his small business. He will buy a variety of sweet breads and French breads so that he can increase his inventory, remained stocked, and be able to meet the greater demand in the marketplace. Jerónimo hopes to improve service to his customers so that his sales will increase. By earning more income, he will be able to gradually improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread and French bread in bulk.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn, 24, lives with her family in the mountainous community of Maluno in the province of Isabela where she operates a very popular motorcycle (tricycle) passenger service that enjoys very strong demand. Genalyn is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy motorcycle parts including tires and a chain in order to continue providing her customers with the best service possible.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts such as tires and a chain for her transport business.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary is married and has three children, two of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. To earn a living, her family has grown vegetables in the Kandal province for almost twenty years. Nary also makes Chinese fried bread sticks and sells them for additional income. Having completely and regularly re-paid her previous two loans, Nary applied for a third loan from VisionFund hoping to get money to serve as an investment to expand her business and also to renovate her house. With the loan, she hopes that her family can live in better conditions and her two kids can be in school until they have graduated.

loans.use: To expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is married and is raising children. He has been selling groceries for over six years. His children and his wife help him with the business. His store is located near his house. Michael is also in the business of processing and selling different products for the community. Besides this, he also raises cattle.

He has many customers and they appreciate him. He has a good reputation and a good credit history. Michael is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 for the purchase of grocery products such as milk, sugar, rice, coffee, and canned goods for his store in order to expand his business. Additionally, with the remaining funds, he wants to buy dried fruit for re-sale.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, coffee, and canned goods for his store.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is twenty-six years old and has one child. He is a loving father. He provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village from 6am to 7pm, from Mondays to Saturdays. Sundays are a family day for Raymond. This way he generates PHP 1,500 each week. 

He would like to gain more profit from his business to save funds for his family's expenses. He is borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle. He promises to pay back his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Elena Helen

texts.en:
Elena Helen from Pallua raises hogs as her business. She sells them upon reaching maturity. She usually earns about PHP 3,000 for each hog she sells. 

Elena Helen is now 41 years old, married, and has one child. She would like to make the business more profitable so she is borrowing additional capital of PHP 7,000 to give enough sustenance to the hogs. She will buy hog feed, medicines, and vitamins.

In the future, Elena Helen would like to keep making the business profitable so she can give the best education to her child, as the only legacy she could pass on to her.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for her hogs' sustainability.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to use in her agriculture business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is thirty-nine years old. She is a single lady residing in Pallua with her parents. To generate income, she raise hogs and sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired size. From this, she is able to gain PHP 3,000 from each hog she sells. 

She is now borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy piglets, feeds and medicines to attain good growth. This will help increase her net income and will allow her to save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and medicines.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en:
Cristine Joy generates income through her direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and other beauty products to the people in her village. She has been in the business for two years now and usually acquires PHP 2,000 each month. 

Christine Joy is now twenty-five years old and has one child. She wants to borrow PHP 6,000 to buy more perfumes, cosmetics and soap to sell. This will help increase sales capacity from the business. 

Christine Joy would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, cosmetics and soap to sell,

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is twenty-four years old, has two young children and is married to a driver named Michael. Jonalyn and her husband raise hogs to sell. This way they gain about PHP 4,000 from each hog the sell. She would like to ensure good nutrition of their hogs so she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability.

In the future, Jonalyn hopes to make her business more profitable so she can earn funds for her children's future needs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is twenty-four years old and married. She has two children attending school. She raises hogs to fatten and re-sell them for profit. She would like to ensure good nutrition of her hogs so that she can re-sell them at a good price. She is asking for PHP 6,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs. Someday she hopes to achieve a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Jorge Salomon

texts.es:
JORGE SALOMON tiene 52 años de edad es casado tiene ocho hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar
JORGE SALOMON se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arveja, fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la cría de pollos y ganados.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abono, urea, líquidos para fumigar, líquidos para la maleza, insecticidas, fertilizantes. Las compras lo hará cada semana en Chillanes.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes sin ningún inconveniente.
El sueño es poder ver a los hijos que terminen los estudios y que mejoren los cultivos para tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar y ver televisión y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Jorge Salomon is 52 years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his wife and children in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Jorge Salomon is a farmer who grows corn, peas, beans, and blackberries. He also raises chickens and cattle. Jorge is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies, compost, urea, liquids for fumigation, liquid weed killers, insecticides, and fertilizers. His purchases are conducted every week in Chillanes. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers without being inconvenienced. His dreams include seeing his children finish their studies, improving his crops, and having more income and a better lifestyle. The challenges he faces include dealing with bad weather.

In his free time, Jorge Salomon enjoys walking, watching television, and partaking in the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, compost, urea, liquids for fumigation, weed killers, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 48, vive en compañía de Ceferino, su esposo, desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales sólo cuidan a cuatro. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el anexo de Usibamba. 	

Todas las mañanas, como es de costumbre, Amelia sale a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues es temporada y necesita de una buena cosecha. Sus principales cultivos constan de alfalfa, pastos, avena y demás alimentos para su ganado, pues se dedica a la crianza de vacas. Ya cuenta con 8; de las cuales, 3 están preñadas, por lo que no brindan leche, y aunque ahora esté escasa, sabe que será por un tiempo, pues cuando ya nacen las terneras las vacas le proporcionarán buena leche y podrá venderla a mejor precio. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a ella realizar es el tejido. Elabora diversas prendas, como chompas, tapetes, colchas y otros artículos a base de lana. Ahí obtiene una ganancia extra y además disfruta de su trabajo. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Usibamba” y éste es el cuarto crédito con MFP. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas a tiempo, pues las personas de su asociación son responsables y muy solidarias.

Amelia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca lechera, con la que piensa aumentar la cantidad de producción de leche.
texts.en:
Amelia, 48, has lived with Ceferino, her husband, for 25 years.  They have five children, only four of whom they take care of.  Her house is her own, located in the settlement of Usibamba.

Every morning, as is her custom, Amelia goes out to take care of her crops because it is the season and she needs a good harvest.  Her main crops are alfalfa, pasture, oats, and other feed for her livestock, because she raises cows.  She already has eight, three of which are pregnant so they do not give milk.  Although the milk is scarce, she knows that it only will be for a time, because when the calves are born, the cows will give good milk and she will be able to sell it at a better price.

But the work she most likes to do is knit.  She makes various items such as sweaters, tablecloths, bedspreads, and other wool articles.  From this she gets extra profits and also enjoys her work.

She belongs to the Usibamba communal bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She promises to make her payments on time because the people in her bank are responsible and very supportive.

Amelia will invest the requested money in buying a dairy cow with which she plans to increase the quantity of milk production.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Albeiro

texts.es:
Albeiro tiene 40 años de edad y desde hace aproximadamente 30 años se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, pues sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad y desde muy temprana edad se la enseñaron y comenzó a trabajar junto a ellos. Gracias a esta experiencia, Albeiro cuenta acualmente con una muy buena reputación ante sus clientes por la buena calidad de los productos que saca su cultivo de frutas, y gracias a esto tiene un buen negocio el cual le brinda los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 18, 17, 15, 14 años y 7 meses de nacido. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Albeiro busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo y así sacar buenos productos de su cultivo de frutas para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá brindando los ingresos necesarios para su hogar de modo que su familia podrá seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida. Además, Albeiro espera que con mejores ingresos pueda cumplir su sueño de brindarles a sus hijos una educación de mejor calidad y a los hijos mayores el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Albeiro, age 40, has devoted himself to the business activity of agriculture for approximately 30 years.  His parents devoted themselves to the same business activity.  They taught him from a very early age, and he started to work with them.

Thanks to this experience, Albeiro currently has a very good reputation with his customers.  He has a good reputation for the good quality of the fruit that he grows.  Thanks to this, he has a good business.  It provides the income needed to support the household expenses.  He lives with his wife and his five children, ages 18, 17, 15, 14, and 7 months.  

Thanks to the very good customer orders that he has, Albeiro is looking to a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops.  That way he will get good products from his fruit crops in order to respond to his customers’ orders.

This way his business will continue to provide the income needed for his household so that his family will be able to continue having a good quality of life.  Also, Albeiro hopes that with improved income he will be able to fulfill his dream of giving his children a better education and of giving the older children access to a college education.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops in order to produce good products and respond to his customers' orders.

loans.name: Miris

texts.es: Miris de 35 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 17,19 y 20 años. Con su esposo de actividad taxista, generan los ingresos para el buen desempeño de su hogar y produjeron la idea de un negocio donde ofrecer servicios de telecomunicaciones, que gradualmente la fueron ampliando  y hoy además venden útiles escolares en un punto comercial, ubicado en su propia casa.  Adicionalmente Miris trabaja en una cafetería mientras su cuñada atiende el SAI,. Ellos empezaron con 3 líneas de celulares y ahora cuenta con 6, su oportunidad de extenderse y fortalecer su negocio, está relacionada con la ubicación de instituciones educativas que funcionan muy cerca a él, lo cual potencializa la venta de cualquier producto ajustado a la población joven y trabajadores de los colegios. En la actualidad planea comprar vitrinas cargadores, celulares, divisiones y vender papelería y fritos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual realizaría todas estas inversiones. La fortaleza de Miris consiste en que conoce perfectamente su negocio y que ha tenido experiencia en la preparación y venta de productos fritos, pues vendió antes de iniciar el negocio actual durante 4 años en tiendas y en un punto fijo. Su negocio tiene un gran potencial de crecimiento y ella lo reconoce, porque tiene el firme propósito de desarrollarlo, para continuar ofreciéndole la oportunidad de estudios profesionales s y especializados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miris, 35, is a married woman with three children whose ages are 17, 19 and 20.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  They generate income for their home’s proper functioning and they came up with the idea of a business offering telecommunication services that they gradually expanded; today they also sell school supplies in a commercial spot located in their home.  In addition, Miris works in a cafeteria while her sister-in-law attends SAI [Ministry of the Interior department].  

They started out with three lines of mobile phones and today have six.  The opportunity to expand and strengthen the business is associated to its proximity to schools which makes potential sales of products adjusted to a young population and school employees.  She is planning to buy display cases, phone chargers, mobile phones, room dividers and to sell stationery supplies and fried snacks.

This is precisely the reason behind her calling on her Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to carry out all these investments.  Miris’ strength consists in her knowing her business perfectly and that she’s had experience preparing and selling fried products because she used to sell them for four years at stores and at a fixed location before starting this business.

Her business has great growth potential and she’s aware of that because she’s firmly determined to develop it to continue offering her children the opportunity to attain professional, specialized studies.

loans.use: to buy display cases, mobile phones, chargers, room dividers and to sell paper goods an fried snacks.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.es: Esterlina de 29 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus  4 hijas en las edades de 7,8,9 y 10 años. Allí mismo se dedica a la fabricación de sandalias femeninas y de calzado  en cuero y en derivados de este. Su negocio lo inició con su cónyuge quien con su experiencia de trabajo en esta actividad, después de 8 años de ser empleado decidió emprender su propia aventura familiar de negocios en lo que era su gran potencial: hacer calzado. Así fue como en su propia casa organizaron su taller y dividieron las tareas, el dedicado a la guarnición y ella al acabado del producto y al empaque. En sus inicios vendía en almacenes en la ciudad de Barranquilla y con su disciplina de trabajo  mancomunado,  han logrado integrar a su base de datos a 25 almacenes en varias ciudades de la Costa Caribe. Sus principales líneas son el calzado deportivo y formal para damas y caballeros. Así mismo elaboran sandalias deportivas pues esta es su producto estrella y cuenta con una gran demanda en esta línea, la cual vende por docenas. . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cuero, sintéticos, suela, gomas, puntillas y adornos, para responde a pedidos que han hecho nuevos almacenes con los cuales desea ser mas oportuna. Su mayor desafío ante su creciente clientela es la falta de capital de trabajo cuando existen temporadas de mayor demanda, como la que se acerca, para celebrar el día de las madres y esta fecha es la que hace que su inversión actual augure mucho éxito en sus ventas y en la rápida rotación de su efectivo.
texts.en:
Esterlina, 29, lives in the town of Malambo very close to the city of Barranquilla with her husband and four daughters whose ages are 7,8,9 and 10 years.  She works manufacturing women’s sandals and shoes out of leather and materials derived from it.  She started her business with her spouse who had experience in this line of work from 8 years of working as an employee and who decided to start their own family business adventure in what had the greatest potential: shoe making.  This was how they set up their shop at home and divided up the tasks: he does the decoration and trimming and she adds the finishing touches and does the packing.

At the beginning they sold in Barranquilla stores and thanks to their disciplined joint work, they’ve managed to add to their data base 25 stores in various cities along the Caribbean coast.  Their main lines are athletic shoes and formal shoes for men and women.  They also make athletic sandals which are their star product and are in very high demand; they sell them by the dozen.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy leather, synthetics, soles, glue, toe caps and decorations to respond to orders placed by new stores she wants to respond to in a more opportune way.  Her greatest challenge in face of her growing clientele is the lack of working capital when high demand seasons come, like the one that’s approaching to celebrate Mother’s Day, and this date is what augurs much investment success in sales and a quick cash rotation.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells various goods such as sugar, biscuits, salt, and cooking oil, and she has been in this business for three years. Her business is open from 6:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. each week.

Maricel has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, biscuits, salt, and cooking oil to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, biscuits, salt, and cooking oil for her store.

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en: Phanny, 34, is married with three children, all of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. Phanny’s family lives in a wooden cottage. Phanny has worked as a farmer for 10 years to support the family. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund. She requested the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase the yield of rice and sell it at profit so that she can better support her family and especially her kids’ education. Phanny now leads a loan group of three female members.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aisulu

texts.ru: Айсулу–участница группы Терек -3. Айсулу 72 года. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1982 году Айсулу начала  заниматься животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы и 6 овец, Айсулу имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS)с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айсулу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Айсулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Aisulu is a member of the Terek-3 group. She is 72 years old. In 1982, to provide a source of income for her family, she began raising livestock. Currently, with 2 dairy cows and 6 sheep in her herd, Aisulu earns 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Aisulu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Carmen Lisseth

texts.es: Carmen Lisseth de 28 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con sus hijos y hermana. Carmen  se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable pero sobre todo carismática. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado mantener su negocio el cual consiste en la venta de zapatos y lociones. La venta  la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales áreas de la zona donde habita. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que es la única que trabaja debido a que su compañero de vida ya no vive con ellos. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el mismo. Gracias a su carisma se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Carmen trabaja muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos dado que es la única que colabora con la economía del hogar. Su sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que se esfuerza para que su negocio siga funcionando de la mejor manera posible. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería, es decir variedad de zapatos y lociones. Para mantenerlo abastecido y poder dar un mejor servicio a los clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos y por consecuencia poder lograr su sueño de dar a su familia  diferentes oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Lisseth is 28 years old and lives in the family home with her children and her sister. She is known for being enterprising, responsible, but most of all, charismatic. With great effort, she has been able to maintain her business that involves selling shoes and lotions. Her sales are conducted by traveling around the main areas of the district where she lives. This business is her main source of income and her only job since her companion no longer lives with her. Carmen has been in this business for many years and has gained a great deal of experience. Thanks to her charisma, she has earned the trust of many people in the area and now has several established customers. Carmen works very hard to help her children get ahead since she is the only one earning household income. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and that of her family, so she strives to keep her business functioning in the best way possible.

Carmen decided to request this loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise, specifically a variety of shoes and lotions. This will help her remain fully stocked so that she can provide better service to her customers. Her intention is to meet the increased demand, improve her sales, and increase her income so that she accomplish her dream of providing her family with different opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and lotions.

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely de 53 años, soltera vive en casa de su propiedad. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir como: blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio y de esta forma se ha ganado la vida ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada y emprendedora. Tiene muchas ideas de negocios las cuales  poco a poco va poniendo en marcha.  Para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que ofrece ya que reconoce que depende mucho de ellos y en la manera que los mantenga satisfechos continuaran frecuentándola y prefiriendo sus productos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir para surtir su negocio para  que los clientes encuentren siempre lo que busquen.  Dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para hacer la inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para hacer la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, y de mas artículos que permitan atraer a más clientes.  Está convencida que con la ayuda de Dios y de esta institución logrará obtener buenos resultados de esta decisión y podrá mejorar sus ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely is 53 years old, single, and lives in her own home. She works as a street merchant and sells clothes such as blouses, skirts, T-shirts, trousers, and other items. Delmy has many years of experience in this business, which has enabled her to earn a living and is her main source of income. She is a hardworking, dedicated, and enterprising woman. Delmy has many ideas for her business that she is gradually implementing. The most important thing for her is to keep her customers satisfied with the service she provides. Much of this depends on her ability to recognize what they need so that they will continue to do business with her and choose her products. For this reason, Delmy has decided to invest in her business by purchasing a variety of clothes. By restocking her business, her customers will always find what they are looking for.

In order to have the necessary financial resources to make this investment, Delmy decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral. She will be able to buy a variety of clothes such as skirts, blouses, trousers, T-shirts, and other types of garments to attract more customers. With the help of God and Apoyo Integral, Delmy is convinced that she will obtain good results because of her decision. She also expects to increase her earnings so that her quality of life can improve.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, trousers, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora; vive en compañía de su madre, Elva, y sus 2 hermanas: Celeste y Ariana. Viven en su casa, que es propia y está ubicada en el anexo de San Pedro de Saño. 

Desde joven apoyó a sus padres en las diferentes actividades económicas que realizaban. Como hermana mayor tomó las riendas del hogar, es por eso que hace algunos años abrió una panadería donde comenzó preparando panes, con el tiempo incursionó en la elaboración de pasteles, tortas y otros postres. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, pues recibe la ayuda de su mamá y de sus hermanas. Esto le permitió abrir otro negocio de cabinas de Internet, comenzó con 4 computadoras y ahora ya cuenta con 9. Sus planes son de expandir más sus negocios, invertir en tecnología y comprar máquinas nuevas que le permitan obtener mejores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San Pedro” y éste es el tercer crédito con MFP. Promete, una vez más, de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Maribel invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de antenas de internet para brindar ese servicio a sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 28, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her mother, Elva, and her two sisters, Celeste and Ariana.  They live in their own house, located in the settlement of San Pedro de Saño.

Since she was little she helped her parents in the different jobs they did.  As the oldest sister she took charge of the household.  This is why several years ago she opened a bakery where she began baking bread.  In time she moved into making cakes, tortes, and other desserts.  It is going very well for her in her job because her mother and her sisters help her.

This allowed her to open another business, an internet cafe.  She began with four computers and now has nine.  Her plans are to expand her business more, invest in technology, and buy new machines to get better profits.

She belongs to the San Pedro communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP.  She promises once again to make her payments.  In addition, it pleases her to be part of her group because all its members are responsible and very supportive people.

Maribel will invest the requested money in buying internet antennas to offer that service to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy internet antennas.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en: Mylin is a 29-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She has a business which retails mobile phones. Mylin has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly income of PHP 13,000. She plans to use the entire loan she has requested to increase her inventory of mobile phone accessories such as cases and phone handles. With the profits, she will buy a plot of land. In the future, she wants to build her own store.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories like cases and phone handle for her business.

loans.name: Boldukan

texts.ru: Болдукан –участница группы Терек -3. Болдукан 33 года. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Болдукан занимается животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову, 14 овец, 1 лошадь,  Болдукан имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Болдукан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Болдукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Boldukan is a member of the Terek-3 group. She is 33 years old. As a source of income for her family, Boldukan raises livestock. With 1 dairy cow, 14 sheep, and 1 horse in her herd, Boldukan makes 4,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Boldukan plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина – 34 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Она женщина -предприниматель, которая имеет свой бизнес. У Зарины свой магазин, в котором она принимает на заказ мебель. Это занятие является основным доходом для семьи. Муж Зарины помогает ей в этом деле. Он изготавливает мебель в цеху с несколькими рабочими. Опыт в этой сфере деятельности более 4 лет. На полученный кредит она хочет закупить сырьё. Муж Зарины очень благодарен за финансовую поддержку, так как ему не надо уезжать на заработки в РФ и быть вместе с семьей.
texts.en: Zarina is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. She is an entrepreneur and runs her own business. With her husband's help, Zarina operates a shop where she makes furniture to order. This business represents the main source of income for her family. Zarina manufactures the furniture in a workshop with several craftsmen. She has over 4 years of experience in this area. She would like to use this loan to purchase raw materials. Zarina's husband is very grateful for the financial support, as he will not have to go to Russia to find work and can stay with his family.

loans.use: to procure raw materials for furniture production

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 40 años, es una mujer seria y con muchas aspiraciones. Vive en compañía de Joel, su esposo, desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Melina, a la que cuidan mucho, su casa es propia y está ubicada en el caserío de Usibamba. 

Las actividades que realiza son diversas. Por la mañana, desde muy temprano, abre las puertas de su casa, donde hace algún tiempo implementó una tienda de comestibles. Como mujer del campo, también se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 4 vacas y vende la leche que producen. Asimismo, siembra en sus terrenos agrícolas; avena, habas, alverja y papa. Cuenta que desde los 15 años comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente, pues tenía que ayudar a su familia, con el tiempo se hizo independiente. Por ello no descansa, al contrario, para el futuro desea aumentar sus ganancias con la compra de cerdos. Ya que piensa ensebarlos y venderlos a los carniceros de la zona. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “Usibamba” y éste es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores préstamos que tubo.

Elba invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado, pues hace poco vendió uno de sus ejemplares.
texts.en:
Elba, 40, is a serious woman with many goals.  She lives with Joel, her husband of 13 years.  They have a daughter, Melina, whom they take care of a lot.  Her house is her own; it is located in the hamlet of Usibamba.

She does various jobs.  In the morning, very early, she opens the doors of her house, where some time ago she set up a grocery store.  As a country woman, she also raises livestock.  She has four cows and she sells the milk they produce.  She also grows crops on her croplands: oats, broad beans, peas, and potatoes.  

She says that since she was 15 she has worked independently because she had to help her family.  In time she became independent.  Because of this she does not rest; on the contrary, for the future she wants to increase her profits with the purchase of pigs.  She plans to fatten them up and sell them to the butchers in the area.

She belongs to the Usibamba group and this is her third loan with MFP.  She promises to be punctual in making her payments, as with the previous loans she had.

Elba will invest the requested money in buying a cow to increase her livestock, because she sold one a short time ago.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old lady from Migori. She is married to Joseph with whom she has two kids, age 2 and 6 years.
Caroline operates a charcoal-selling business, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of 4,800 KES. 
She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more charcoal sacks for re-sale. Her profits will be used to pay the loan.
Her dream is to put her kids through college.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 33 years old, married, and blessed with three children, aged nine, six and four years, respectively.  He is a photographer (both still and video), a business he started seven years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. He has requested his first loan with KADET for KES 15,000 to purchase a still camera. The profit he earns will help him buy an editing suite for his photographs. His dream is to produce quality videos and movies as well as own a printing company some day.

loans.use: To purchase a still camera.

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суйумкан – лидер группы Терек -4, объединяющей еще двух участников. Суйумкан 46 лет, вдова,  имеет 4 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1995 году Суйумкан начала  заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суйумкан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Suyumkan is the leader of the Terek-4 group, which contains two other members. Suyumkan is 46 years old, widowed, and has 4 children. To provide for her family, Suyumkan began raising livestock in 1995. Her business, launched with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS), presently earns roughly 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Suyumkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 38-year-old lady from Vihiga. She is married to a man named Eugene and they have two children between 10 and 18 years old. 

Violet sells maize cereal, a business she has been doing for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of maize cereal. Her profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her kids.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita started sewing and weaving to generate income to support her home. When she saw the need in the market, she opened a general store where she offers all types of products for basic family needs. In her store, Rosita is known for offering very good products and offering very good service. This has allowed her to have a lot of customers and guarantee good sales. She has the difficulty of having to take care of her father. He is very ill and elderly. This prevents her from keeping her business open as much as she would like to for her customers. Despite this, her business' good reputation has made her customers continue to buy from her and helped her business grow little by little over time.
