loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime  es un hombre  que tiene  40 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con dos hijo a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Jaime  vive  en el  caserío Nueva Esperanza del distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Jaime es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Nueva Esperanza  – Tambogrande y visciversa. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de aves de corral, y además cuenta con 0.5 ha de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón y mango generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Jaime cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Jaime esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1300 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de neumáticos y aros), compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo y compra de alimentos para sus animales esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 40 years old.  He is married and has two children in his care.  He lives with his wife and children in his own home.  He comments that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence.  Most of the people in his community are self employed and work in commerce, farming and livestock raising.  Jaima lives in the small village of Nueva Esperanza, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  His home is connected to the electricity supply.  He tells us that all the families in his district live in the same conditions.

Jaime's business activity is providing a motorcycle taxi service.  He provides a service between Nueva Esperanza and Tambogrande.  He also raises and fattens farmyard birds and has 0.5 hectares of farmland where he grows lemons and mangos.  This makes him additional income with which to cover his personal expenses.  We should point out that Jaime has eight years experience in the public transport business.  This has allowed him to gain a steady customer base for his business.

Jaime is currently requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,300 soles.  He will use this sum to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle (changing his tires and hubcaps).  He will also buy fertilizers for his crops and feed for his animals.  This is a very profitable business activity in his area and, over time, he hopes that it will allow him to continue improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi, to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 45 años; vive en compañía de León, su esposo, y Nilton su hijo menor. Tienen una casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. 

Teofila tiene una gran trayectoria en las actividades agrícolas, pues son 30 años de haber  cultivado la tierra y de criar animales. Durante años, junto a su esposo, ha podido sostener a sus 3 hijos que ahora son personas independientes. Ella se siente contenta de haber educado a sus hijos y solo le queda en adelante continuar para  seguir cultivando la tierra para el sostén de ella y de su esposo, ellos siguen cultivando maíz y papa, que son los principales productos de su tierra. También se dedican a la crianza de animales, principalmente la vaca y el toro, los que les sirve para la venta. Adicionalmente, también vende comida en su casa.

Este es el crédito número 5 que tiene con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, además le agrada su grupo porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. 

Teófila invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos, el resto del dinero lo usará para adquirir fibra para su ganado.
texts.en:
Teófila, 45, lives with León, her husband, and with Nilton, her youngest son.  They own their house located in Huachac.

Teófila has a long trajectory working in agricultural activities since it’s been 30 years since she’s been working the land and raising livestock. During these years, alongside her husband, she’s been able to support her three children who are now independent people.  She feels happy to have educated her children and all that remains for her now is to continue working the land to support her and her husband.  They continue growing corn and potatoes, the main products of her land.  They also raise livestock, mainly cows and bulls that they sell.  She also sells food at home.

This is loan #5 with MFP where she feels fulfilled and she also likes her group because its members are supportive, hardworking people.

Teófila will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her crops; the rest of the money will be used to buy fiber for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and livestock feed.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer que tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con dos hijos  y su cónyuge en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Margarita vive en casa propia en el caserío Tranca Fanupe del distrito de Mòrrope del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo  cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Margarita es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral  y caprinos , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Margarita cuenta con 12 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge le apoya en este tipo de negocio, donde poseen una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Margarita se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde, vitaminas y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is thirty-four years old and married. She lives with her spouse and two children in a house that they own. Quality of life in the community is at subsistence level and the majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who make their livings breeding and selling smaller animals. Some also make a living through agriculture. Margarita lives in her own house in Tranca Fanupe, a small town in the Mórrope district of the "departamento" of Lambayaque. They have basic services such as electricity and get their water from a handmade well. All the local families live under these conditions.

Margarita makes her living breeding, fattening, trading, and selling smaller animals such as poultry and goats. She raises these animals in corrals outside her house. However, she mentions that the sale of these animals takes place in a local market and that she has wholesale buyers of the animals. It is worth noting that Margarita has twelve years of experience in this business, which has permitted her to maintain an established clientele. Her husband supports her in the business, and they work well together in this area.

At this point, Margarita has proposed to expand her inventory in regard to breeding and selling animals (pigs, goats, and poultry), since it is a very profitable business in the area. It is because of these circumstances that she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN which she will use to buy balanced feed and vitamins to fatten the animals and to pay for repairs to their corrals. In time, this will permit her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and balanced feed to fatten her animals and to pay for repairs to their corrals.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, junto a  su esposo tienen un hijo de 10 años de edad y por el cual ambos luchan día con día para sacarlo adelante tenga una vida feliz y con calidad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano así como también es muy conocida porque sus pobladores tienen una buena sazón para la preparación de alimentos; cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta pasarlo con su familia y atenderlos; así como también le gusta preparar su platillo favorito, el cual es el riquísimo “Picante de Res”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Maria trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y sobre todo muy conocida por los clientes.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora y un televisor para su vivienda, con esta mejora ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que ellos no tenían estos artefactos y sobre todo para comodidad de su hijo; Maria seguirá trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:”Construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking person. She and her husband have a 10-year-old son and they both strive everyday to get him ahead so that he can live a good and happy life. Their house is located in the town of Chincha, which is known for being home to the great glories of Peruvian sports. The town is also known for the fact that its people are skilled at food preparation. When she has free time, she enjoys spending time with her family and taking care of them. She also enjoys making her favorite dish, the delicious "picante de res" (spicy meat stew).
Maria works on her beauty product selling business with a lot of enthusiasm. She works around 8 hours a day and she can serve up to 10 customers a day. She believes that her business does well because she's very charismatic and most of all because she's very very well-known among customers.
Maria is very thankful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to purchase a washing machine and a television for her home. With this improvement, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions, since they didn't have these appliances. They are above all for her son's convenience. Maria will keep on working on a daily basis in order to make her biggest dream come true: "To build her house with noble materials".

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and a television.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm, and it was very profitable. She was able to repay the loan amount completely and in good time.

She plans to use this loan to buy four bags of fertilizer and seeds for planting during this rainy season. These seeds include potato and maize, which usually have a ready market due to the high demand for them in most parts of the country; therefore, she anticipates to make a good profit.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her farming business and to make more income; hence, improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luz De Los Rios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Luz de los Ríos”, esta conformado por  19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran lencería, confección, artesanía, ventas de frutas, pescadería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Maria, presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien se encuentra al fondo del grupo, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Su cabello lo usa  suelto, además usa aros grandes y viste con un poleron gris.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la amasandería desde hace 15 años. Comenta que arrienda local comercial de su madre, quien es dueña de casa.
Ella prepara sus productos de amasandería en forma artesanal, ocupando sus manos.
Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde la 11 ° ° AM sin horario específico de cierre. Su clientela es fija a pesar de la competencia que tiene en su entorno.
Su mercadería que utiliza la compra generalmente en supermercados y mayoristas.
Con el crédito comprara insumos varios para su  panadería.
Sus metas son poder comprar maquinarias para facilitar su rutina diaria de trabajo.
Actualmente vive con su esposo trabajador obrero de construcción e hija pequeña de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños son poder terminar de estudiar computación.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha  brindado Fondo Esperanza para  invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que existe respeto y confianza.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco),
Cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Luz de los Ríos”  (Light of the Rivers) and it’s composed of 19 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work among which are found lingerie, sewing, crafts, fruit sales, fish store and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Valdivia.

María, communal bank president, is located in the rear of the group occupying the third spot from right to left.   She’s wearing her hair loose and she's wearing large hoop earrings and a gray shirt.  She’s been working as a baker for 15 years.  She comments that she rents a commercial locale from her mother who is a house owner.  She prepares her baked goods in an artisan way; she uses her hands.

Her work schedule is Monday to Sunday from 11am on with no specific closing time.  Her clientele is regular despite the competition she has around her.  She buys the ingredients she uses usually in supermarkets and from wholesalers.  She will use the loan to buy various ingredients for her bakery.  Her goal is to be able to buy machinery to make her daily work routine easier.

She currently lives with her construction worker husband and nine year old daughter. Her dream is to be able to finish studying computer science.  
She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the group she participates in because there is respect and trust.

Valdivia is a city in south Chile located in the Los Ríos region.   It stands out for having one of Chile’s few navigable rivers, the Calle-Calle.  Among 
Valdivia’s main economic activities is naval construction, saw mills, paper mills and cellulose (Celco), breweries and flour mills.  Tourism also plays an important part as well as university educational services headed by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Union Y Amistad Group

texts.es:
Gilberta tiene 54 años de edad, ella es una mujer trabajadora y su trabajo es muy inusual ella es partera desde hace más de 18 años, dice que aprendió sola y poco a poco a perfeccionado sus técnicas, ella es reconocida por el Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social de México ya que ellos le han dado capacitaciones para dar un mejor servicio en su comunidad, ella dice que cada año van muchas mujeres a que les dé el servicio de partera y a darle seguimiento a su embarazo. Dice que  es un trabajo que  la enorgullece el traer niños al mundo, ella comprara vendas, algodón, gasas, alcohol, medicamentos para el dolor, jabon quirurjico y más. 
Platica que el crédito le servirá de mucho por que tendrá el material necesario para dar un buen servicio a su comunidad. La meta que tiene Gilberta es seguir ayudando a su comunidad y hacer un cuarto especial para los partos ella quisiera tener un equipo para hacer ultrasonidos y vean las mujeres como vienen sus niños. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman Lidia, Ofelia, Marisol, Fabián, Sandra y Juan Carlos ellos invertirán sus créditos en artículos para surtir en una cooperativa escolar, en la compra de borregos y alimento para estos, en compra de ropa para damas y niñas, insumos para cultivo de durazno y aguacate y venta de frutas y legumbres.
texts.en: Gilberta is 54 years old and is a hard-working woman. Her job is very unusual, as she has been a midwife for more than 18 years. She says that she learned on her own and little by little perfected her techniques. She is recognized by Mexico's social welfare institute, which has given training to provide a better service in her community. Gilberta says that every year many women come to her for her midwife service and to keep track of their pregnancies. She says that through this work she is proud to bring children into the world. She plans to buy bandages, cotton, gauze, alcohol, pain medicines, surgical soap and other items. She says that this loan will help her out a lot because she will have the necessary materials to provide a good service to her community. Gilberta's goal is to keep helping her community and to have a special birthing room that she would like to equip with ultrasounds so the women can see how their babies are coming along. The other six members of the group are Lidia, Ofelia, Marisol, Fabián, Sandra and Juan Carlos. They plan to use the loan to purchase supplies for a cooperative school, to purchase sheep and food for the animals, to purchase clothing for women and young girls, to purchase supplies to cultivate peach and avocado, and to sell fruits and legumes.

loans.use: to purchase materials for child births like bandages, cotton, gauze, alcohol, pain medicine, etc.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a forty-three year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has worked in agriculture for ten years, and he is now one of the model farmers in his village.  He has a personal goal of educating his children, and he dreams of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming, despite the challenges in season variations. Deo needs the loan to pay workers who are tilling his farms.

loans.use: To pay workers who are tilling his farms

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana   es una mujer que tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, con dos hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia con su hijo  y su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. Roxana vive en casa propia en el caserío Escute del distrito de Pacora del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo solo  cuenta con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y agua; también se menciona que en este caserío viven casi todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Roxana  es la  crianza/venta de animales menores y venta de bebidas (gaseosas, cerveza y chicha de jora), este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados;   y cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su cónyuge  se dedica a la peluquería y también  lo apoyan arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente  Roxana se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de animales (chivos, aves de corral) y surtir un poco más su negocio en la venta de bebidas; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Roxana is 25 years old, married and has two children. She lives in her own home with her children and husband. It is mentioned that the quality of life in her community is that of subsistence. The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who make a living in agriculture, livestock and raising small animals, and some also are involved in commerce. Roxana lives in the hamlet of Escute, district of Pacora, department of Lamayeque in a home that only has basic electric and water services. Nearly all of the families in the hamlet live under these conditions. Roxana makes a living raising and selling small animals and also sells beverages (soft drinks, beer and chica de jora, a traditional local drink) out of her home, where she tends to faithful customers. She has two years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain a clientele in both businesses. Her husband is a barber and also arduously supports Roxana in her activities as part of a good relationship between them. Currently, Roxana wants to expand the inventory of her small businesses since they are very lucrative ones for her area. It's for this reason she is requesting a new loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to use to purchase animals (goats and poultry) and to stock her beverage business a little bit more. In time, this will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals, feed and beverages.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with one child who is 3 years old. The child is still too young to attend school. 

Emmanuel has been a rice farmer for 10 years. His wife also works as a farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy seeds for rice production.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a farm equipment business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Arlyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm equipment and spare parts for her farm equipment business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through seven previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm equipment and spare parts

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Irene has been in this business for 30 years.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her business. Irene earns more income from raising pigs.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Charito works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Charito has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Charito aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO AMIGAS  ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO ES SU TERCER CICLO. EL GRUPO LLEVA ESE NOMBRE YA QUE LAS INTEGRANTES SON VECINAS Y MUY AMIGAS DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS. EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR 7 INTEGRANTES

MARIA EUGENIA ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO; TIENE 46 AÑOS, ES CASADA, CON 3 HIJOS DE 30,18,Y 17 AÑOS DE EDAD.
LA SRA MARIA EUGENIA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE HAMBURGUESASAS EN SU DOMICILIO, TRABAJA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS Y ASI DARLE UNA MEJOR VIDA A SUS 2 HIJOS QUE VIVEN CON ELLA QUE SON EL DE 18 Y 17 AÑOS Y ACTUALMENTE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO LA PREPARATORIA.LA SRA. MARIA EUGENIA QUIERE SU PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR Y TENER SUFICIENTES INSUMOS EN SU NEGOCIO PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS. TAMBIEN PIENSA COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA TERNER MAS VARIEDAD EN LA VENTA DE ALIMENTOS, COMO EMPEZAR A VENDER TACOS Y GORDITAS Y ASI TENER MAS GANACIAS. 
SU META A LARGO PLAZO ES LLEGAR A TENER UN LOCAL BIEN ESTABLECIDO EN UNA AVENIDA CERCA DE SU CASA, Y ATENDERLO JUNTO CON SU FAMILIA PARA PERMANECER UNIDOS. CON ESTO, EUGENIA PIENSA TENER UNA MEJOR VIDA TANTO ELLA COMO SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: The Amigas group is in its third loan cycle. The group took this name because the members have been friends and neighbors for a number of years. The group consists of seven members, including Maria Eugenia. She is 46 years, married and has three children, ages 30, 18 and 17. She has a business selling hamburgers out of her home. She works to help her husband with household expenses and provide a better life for the younger two children who still live with them. They are both currently in high school. Maria Eugenia is requesting the loan to invest in ingredients to increase her sales. She also plans to purchase what she needs to start selling more variety, like tacos and gorditas, and in this way increase her profits. Her long-term goal is to have a well-established restaurant on an avenue near her home and to tend to it alongside her family so they can all stay united. With this, she plans to have a better life both for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Telmo

texts.es:
Telmo  es un hombre que tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Telmo vive en  el caserío Palominos del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo  cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Purificación es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral  y ovinos , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Telmo cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su propia mototaxi, la cual le generan ingresos diarios para cubrir obligaciones crediticias  y familiares , su cónyuge también  le apoyan en este tipo de negocio, donde poseen una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Telmo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (ovinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde, vitaminas y compra de llantas para su vehículo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Telmo is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his three children and his spouse in a house he owns. Living conditions in his community are at subsistence levels and most of the people who live there are independent workers. They work in retail, raise small animals and in addition some of them also work in farming. Telmo lives in the settlement of Palominos, district of Tambogrande, department of Piura. They get basic electricity services, and they get water from an artesian well. All the families who live there are under these conditions.
His business is raising, fattening and selling small animals such as corral poultry and sheep. He raises these animals in corrals outside of his home, but he sells them at the local market or to wholesale animal buyers. Telmo has 4 years of experience in this business, which has allowed him to maintain his well-established clientele. He also works in passenger transportation with his own motorcycle taxi, which provides him with a daily income in order to meet his credit and family obligations. His spouse also supports him in this type of business and they share a good family relationship.
Telmo currently intends to stock up his animal (corral poultry and sheep) fattening and sales business, since it's a very profitable activity in the area. For those reasons he requests a new loan to Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1.500 nuevos soles. He will use the loan to purchase animal feed and vitamins and to purchase tires for his motorcycle taxi. In time, this will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his animals, and to purchase tires for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 47 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Luisa works hard to provide for her family. She sells Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Ma. Luisa has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling Avon products for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Ma. Luisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a thirty-four-year-old woman from Kisumu. She is married to Tom, and they have two children aged twelve and fourteen years.

Loice sells beauty items like necklaces and detergents. She has had this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of necklaces for resale. She will use her profits to stabilize the business and also to educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of necklaces.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is twenty-seven years old and married with one child.

Digna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a gasoline retail business in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more gallons of gasoline to sell.

Digna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her gasoline retail business for three years and also earns an income running a general store.

Digna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Jacton

texts.en:
Jacton is 27 years old and the owner of a tailoring shop in Mombasa. He is married and has been sewing clothes for his customers for the last three years with great success.  

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and more clothing material. 

He will use the anticipated profits to give back to his business and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-established business

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and more clothing material

loans.name: Lorine

texts.en:
Lorine is a twenty-five-year-old single woman from Kisumu, who currently supports three people in her family.

Lorine operates a salon, a business she has had for the last four years, and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She is now taking her first loan from KADET, which she will use to buy salon equipment. She will use her profits to grow her business and repay the loan.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: La Grace Divine 2 (#3) Group

texts.en:
Ida, age 48, is a single mother with 2 children. One of her children is still in school. She also cares and provides for her elderly mother. Ida is representing the La Grace Divine 2 (#3) group.

She owns a small grocery stand and a restaurant. She has been operating this shop and restaurant for 2 years. She will use the loan to pay for an expansion to her grocery stand. Her business strategy is to use the food that is not selling quickly in her restaurant before it spoils. She is able to obtain good prices on her food products because she buys in bulk for use in her stand and restaurant.

Ida has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to grow her grocery stand and restaurant into large businesses where she can employ many people. She wants her business success to aid her children in their studies.

loans.use: to expand her grocery stand.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in Airport.  She is 48 years old.  She is married and has four children between 12 and 25 years old.  The children live at home and go to school.  For ten years now, she has been selling dried fish in the market.  She started this business by selling fresh and dried fish for her sister. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish for her business.  She likes the independence her business has brought to her.   Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business

loans.name: Tutugirl

texts.en:
Tutugirl is 33 years old, married and lives in Airport, Liberia. She has four children who live at home. Three of them attend school. Her husband is a contractor. 

For the past fifteen years, she has been selling biscuits, candy, fresh milk, bread and other items in her community. She learned this way of selling from her mother, and is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, fresh milk, bread and other items for her business. She enjoys being supportive of her family, and plans on building a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, fresh milk, bread and other items for her business.

loans.name: El Saucito De Donaciano Group

texts.es: Ángel tiene 33 años de edad, está casado con la señora Griselda y tienen 3 hijos pequeños Eleazar de 13 años, Rodrigo de 9 años ambos estudiantes de primaria y Uriel de 6 años estudiante de preescolar. Ángel platica que se dedica a la albañilería en la ciudad de México y en su localidad, desde hace más de 21 años, y dice que está pidiendo un crédito para comprar una pulidora para lijar el azulejo que pone en las casas. Dice que poco a poco su actividad esta prosperando ya que ha comprado sus herramientas que tanta falta le hacen para hacer sus trabajos. Dice que problemas tan fuertes no tiene ya que poco a poco se está haciendo de su herramienta que tanto ocupa para poner los pisos o azulejos a los baños y cocinas. Dice que este crédito le va a beneficiar por que comprara lo que le falta de herramienta para hacer crecer su negocio de albañilería. Uno de sus sueños es hacer su casa de tabique y comprarse una camionetita de uso para poder trasladarse más fácilmente a la ciudad de México para que ya no le cobren tanto flete por la herramienta en los autobuses. Los otros cinco integrantes se llaman Máxima, María Blanca, Esmeralda, Isabel y Mariana ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de material para hacer artesanía de ocoshal y para comprar insumos para el cultivo de aguacate y cría de pescado trucha.
texts.en: Ángel is 33 year old, married to Griselda and has three young children: Eleazar, 13, and Rodrigo, 9, are in elementary school, and Uriel, 6, is in preschool. Ángel has made a living in construction in Mexico City and in his town for more than 21 years, and says he is requesting the loan to purchase a sander to sand tiles that he puts in homes. He says that little by little his activity is prospering because he has purchased much-needed tools for his work, and that will continue when he gets a tool to help him put down flooring or tiles in bathrooms and kitchens. He says that he is going to benefit from this loan because he will purchase the tool he has been lacking to grow his construction business. One of his dreams is to build himself a brick house and to purchase a truck that he could use to more easily commute to Mexico City and not have to pay to freight his tools. The other five members are Máxima, María Blanca, Esmeralda, Isabel and Mariana, who plan to invest the loan in the purchase of materials to make crafts, to purchase ingredients to cultivate avocado and to farm trout.

loans.use: to purchase a sander to sand tile.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes nos cuenta que tiene 36 años de edad por el momento está viviendo en unión libre con el señor Carlos juntos han formado una familia con sus cuatro hijos que van a la escuela anteriormente doña Lourdes ya habia estado en uno grupo grande esta vez ha solicitado un crédito individual para invertirlo en su negocio de venta y compra de pollos con el crédito comprar mas pollos y algunos duces, la cantidad no sabe porque comprar poco poco.
Doña Lourdes lleva ya 7 años en su negocio ella comprar el pollo vivo a un menor precio para luego venderlo ella a domicilio a un precio más alto ya casi siempre tiene muchos pedido ya esta en casa o en las localidades más cercanas.
Cuando la vistamos estaba muy contenta ya que pudo contarnos que gracias la semana santa pudo vender4 mucho, sin embrago la dificultad más grande a la que se presenta doña Lourdes es cuando no hay ningún evento y casi no hay ventas y peor aun si encargo muchos pollos se quedaran ahí sin vender, pero esto no la desanima ya que sabe que si hoy no vendió mañana le irá mejor.
Una de las metas de doña Lourdes es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia más que nada para mejorar la educación de sus hijos quiere que terminen una carrera para que tengan una mejor vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con el crédito ya que con sus ganancias podrá comprarles zapatos, alimento, ropa a los niños.
texts.en:
Lourdes tells us that she is 36 years old and right now she is in a common law marriage with Carlos. Together they have formed a family with their four children who are in school. Previously, Lourdes was in a large group. This time, she has asked for an individual loan to invest in her business selling chickens. With the loan she will buy more chickens and some candies to sell. She doesn't know how many because she buys little by little.  

Lourdes has had the business for 7 years. She buys the live chickens at a lower price to later sell them at a higher price. She almost always has a lot of orders and sells from her house or in the nearby communities. When we visited her she was very happy since she was able to tell us that thanks to Holy Week she was able to sell a lot. Nonetheless, Lourdes' biggest problem is when there is no event and almost no sales and if worst of all she ordered a lot of chickens, they go unsold. This doesn't discourage her, though, because if she doesn't sell today, tomorrow will be better.   

One of Lourdes's goals is to improve her and her family's quality of life. Above all, to improve her children's education. She wants them to finish college so they can have a better life. She is very happy and grateful with the loan since with her earnings she can buy shoes, clothes, and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Diosdada is 58 years old and has two children who are in school.

Diosdada has a food vending business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Diosdada has been in this business for three years. In the future, Diosdada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase washing detergent, bar soap, cooking fat and soda to stock in his shop.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Aroma” libertad está conformado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y responsables el nombre del grupo se eligió de esa manera ya que no se decidían por un nombre ellos querían el nombre de alguna flor u planta sin embargo entre bromas salió el nombre de aroma se le ocurrió a un hombre que ahora ya no se encuentra a en el grupo.  Doña Adela quien es la representante del grupo nos comenta que tiene 50 años de edad es mama soltera tiene tres hijos que dependen aun de ella, Doña Adela se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como pollos, guajolotes, patos, cerdos y borregos esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 4 cerdos y laminas porque quiere arreglar su chiquero porque le gotea cuando llueve y se mojan, también comprara 4 borregos ya tiene el zacate para sus borregos  pero no lo ha pagado con el crédito pagara, Doña Adela cuenta que esta actividad porque el pueblo donde vive es costumbre que las personas se dediquen a la crianza de animales también porque de alguna manera tenía que sacar adelante  a sus hijos, ella aprendía al cuidado de estos animales gracias a su mama , para doña Adela le parece mejor comerse los animales que cría en casa porque no tienen tanta grasa como los que se venden en los mercados,
Unos de los retos más grandes que presenta doña Adela es cuando sus animes enferman y mueren porque es pérdida de ganancias e inversión también porque gasta mucho en el veterinaria y medicamento para sus animales.
Una de las metas de doña Adela es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y trabajen en lo que están estudiando, ella está muy contenta porque su hijo José Luis pronto terminara su Licenciatura en Educación, doña Adela está muy agradecida con el crédito ya que gracias el ha podido solventar los gastos del hogar y para la educación de sus hijos, también porque gracias al crédito ha podido poner un puestito pequeño de chicharrones y dulces y de las ganancias que saca de este negocio es para los gastos de su hijo más pequeño Mario Alberto que se encuentra estudiando en cuarto grado de primaria, doña Adela y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidas con FRAC y KIVA por el crédito otorgado ya que cada una de ellas podrán compraran sus animales,  Yolanda, Martha Patricia, Laura, Agripina, Magdalena compraran pollos,  María Luisa y Lourdes compraran borregos.
texts.en:
The group "Aroma" consists of 10 hardworking and responsible women. The name of their group was chosen after the members had a difficult time deciding whether to name their group after some type of flower or plant. They ended up choosing the name "Aroma" after it was suggested jokingly by a gentleman who is no longer with the group.

Doña Adela is the group representative. She is 50 years old and a single mother with three dependent children. Doña Adela raises and sells animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, pigs, and sheep. This time she is requesting a loan to buy four pigs and lumber so that she can repair her pig sty that has a roof that leaks when it rains. She also acquired four heads of sheep and hay for them to feed on, so she will also use her loan to pay for them since they were purchased on credit. Doña Adela is in this business because it is customary for people in her town to raise animals. This business also gives her a way of helping her children get ahead. She learned how to take care of animals from her mother. For Doña Adela, the best part is being able to consume the animals she raises because they do not have as much fat as those sold at the markets.

One of Doña Adela's greatest challenges is dealing with situations when her animals get sick. If the animals die, she loses revenue and her investment capital. In addition, the cost of veterinary care and medicines for her animals is very expensive. One of Doña Adela's goals is to see her children finish their education and find a job in their field of study. She is very pleased because her son, José Luis, recently finished his degree in Education. Doña Adela is extremely grateful for this loan because it will allow her to cover the household expenses and pay for her children's education. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to open a small stand where she could sell pork rinds and sweets. The profits were used to pay for the expenses of her youngest son, Mario Alberto, who is studying in the fourth grade.

Doña Adela and the rest of her group are very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the loan that has been granted. Each of them will buy animals. Yolanda, Martha Patricia, Laura, Agripina, and Magdalena will buy chickens. María Luisa and Lourdes will buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy pigs, sheep, hay, and lumber for repairing a pig sty.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Las Piñitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El  grupo  se integra de tres señoras  quienes viven en el barrio santa Cecilia ellas se dedican a la elaboración de comidas.

   La señora quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama María Leonila, ella es casada con el señor freydi y con quien procreo  un hijo   que tiene la edad  de siete meses en la que comenta  que es muy afortunada de tener una familia unida.

   Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo  y es para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas y venderlo  de casa  en casa o en su cocina económica, en donde aun va a  iniciar con esta pequeña actividad y es para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.

     Se dedicara a esta actividad para así  poder trabajar el crédito  y estar de manera puntual en sus pagar y también para apoyar se con los ingresos y trabajar con su suegra con el negocio.
 
     Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella logre seguir adelante  para que con el tiempo  tener una cocina económica propia y le deje uno mejor ingreso.

   Quienes son integrantes del grupo  son: Marbel quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y la señora Aurora invertirá en  cocina económica.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the neighborhood of Santa Cecilia. They make a living by preparing food. The woman who was interviewed is María Leonila. She is married to Freydi, and they have a seven-month-old son. She says she is very fortunate to have a close family.

This is the first time she is requesting a loan, which will be used to invest in buying ingredients for food preparation and then selling the food door-to-door, or in her home-style restaurant, which she is going to start through this small activity. She is doing this to help her husband with the household income.

She will make a living through this work so she can pay off the loan and be punctual with the payments. Also, she will help by gaining income. She will work with her mother-in-law in this business.

María hopes that with this small activity, she will be able to continue forward so that with time, she will have her own home-style restaurant that will provide her a better income.

The members of the group are as follows: Marbel, who will invest in buying ingredients for making tamales, and Aurora, who will invest in a home-style restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 61 años, es una mujer admirable. Enviudó hace 20 años, del que fue su esposo, José, con quien tuvo 3 hijos; de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos, Manuel. La casa donde vive es propia y está ubicada en el distrito de Cajas Chico.  

A pesar de criar sola a sus hijos ella mantiene la misma fortaleza de siempre. La venta de verduras fue y es la actividad con la que sostiene a su familia, de la que se siente muy orgullosa. Su trabajo es arduo, pues tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares donde se esté realizando una feria. Es así que trabaja de lunes a domingo, sin descanso, ganando un promedio de 70 a 80 soles diarios. En todo este tiempo, también logró adquirir un puesto propio en el mercado de su localidad, y por otro lado recibe el apoyo de su último hijo quien trabaja como albañil. En adelante, Juana desea abrir un negocio estable con el que pueda mantenerse, sin preocupaciones, por el resto de su vida. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “Las Wanquitas” y éste es el décimo séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está contenta porque tiene el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su trabajo. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además, le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Juana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de verduras, por canastas, para la venta en las ferias.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old. She is and admirable woman. She became a widow 20 years ago when her husband, José, died. She had 3 children with hims and one of them lives with her, Manuel. She owns the house she lives in, which is located in the Cajas Chico district.  

Despite raising her children alone, she has remained as strong as ever. Selling vegetables has been and is the activity she supports her children with and she is very proud of that. Her work is arduous because she has to travel to different places where a market is happening. She works Monday through Sunday without stopping, earning an average of 70 to 80 soles a day. During all this time, she was also able to acquire her own spot in the market of the town where she lives. On the other hand, she receives support from her youngest son who works as a bricklayer. In the future, Juana wants to open a stable business to support herself, without worrying, for the rest of her life.  

She belongs to the  “Las Wanquitas” group and this is the seventeenth loan she has taken out with MFP. She is happy there because she has the financial support to advance with her work. She promises to make her payments on time. In addition, she likes being a part of the association because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. 

Juana will invest the money she has asked for in buying bushels of vegetables to sell in the markets.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan amount to buy two dairy cows and this increased his profits. He was able to repay the loan amount well and in good time.

Being a mixed farmer, he plans to use this fourth loan amount of Kenya shillings 30,000(KES) to buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals for use in his farm. He also plans to use part of the loan amount for ploughing and land preparation in readiness for planting during this rainy season.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his farming business and get more income. This will enable him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals, and to plough the land.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a very conscientious mother and wife. She manages the raising of livestock in her own home as a source of income. Aside from this business, she also helps her husband in farming in order to produce higher profits every month. 

Now, through the eagerness to develop her business and income, she is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy livestock such as chicken, medicines and feed. She is hoping that through her hard work she could soon earn higher income in order to lift up her family from poor living.

loans.use: to buy livestock such as chicken, medicines and feed.

loans.name: Neker

texts.en: Neker lives in Airport.  She is 38 years old.  She did not go to school, and she has four children between 13 to 24 years in age.  She has been running a restaurant for the past 18 years, where she sells soft drinks, cold water, and Liberian food.  She started this business with 500 LD, which she received from her children's father.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, pepper, palm oil, onion and rice for her business.  Her plan is to live a happy life with her children.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, cold water, pepper, palm oil, onion and rice for her business

loans.name: Nassie

texts.en:
Nassie is serving people in their "barangay" (neighborhood) through her manicure and pedicure services.  She has been doing this as a source of income for over 11 years. She is very patient and positive in her work. This is for the welfare of her six children; that’s why she patiently does her work. She wants to attract more customers though offering better services, but she suffers from insufficient funds to buy new materials.


In connection with this, she is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy cuticle remover, nail polish and nippers. She is hoping that with her artistic way of working, she will be able to gain more customers to attain higher income. She could then save for the future of her children and family.

loans.use: to buy cuticle remover, nail polish and nippers

loans.name: John Peter

texts.en:
John Peter is single. He has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and cover labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mercedario 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDARIO 2” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Victoria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de dulces.

La señora Victoria, indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, mismo que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres), que comprará de la feria de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The “MERCEDARIO 2” community bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani center. It is made up of six people and led by  board of directors headed by Victoria. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them we have: selling food, selling clothes, and selling candies.  

Victoria indicates that this is the first time she has been in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a counselor. Right no she has a business selling food, which she has done for some years.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (to buy food). She will buy in the El Alto market and later she will make and sell in her sales space. This job will allow her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives in a common law marriage and has a son.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health care.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: San Alejandro Agricultura Group

texts.es: Braulia tiene 35 años de edad y es parte del grupo San Alejandro y dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo por que donde viven se llama la comunidad así. Ella está casada y tiene tres hijos, ella es originaria de una localidad donde su actividad económica es la producción de Noche Buena y las artesanías de ocoshal, dice que se da mucho la artesanía y los recuerditos ya que muy cerca de su comunidad se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca. doña Braulia es una de las personas que llevan adelante esta producción que año con año adornan las casas en la época decembrina, dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas, y macetas ya que ahorita empezó la producción. Ella tiene con este negocio desde hace 5 años y dice que lo emprendió para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que son varios hijos los que tienen y todos están en la escuela. Dice que para ella es un orgullo trabajar con este tipo de flor ya que gente de otros países van a hasta su comunidad a comprarlas y se las llevan hasta sus países y eso la llena de felicidad por que ven lo importante que es el trabajo del campesino. Una de sus metas es poner otro vivero donde pueda producir más flor dice que este año que paso ahorro para comprar el material y pronto dice que lo pondrá. los integrantes del grupo se llaman Veronica, Leticia y berenice ellas invertiran sus creditos en insumos para el cultivo de flor de noche buena.
texts.en: Braulia is 35 years old and belongs to the San Alejando group, which is the same name as the group's community. Braulia is married and has three children. She is originally from this community, where the economic activity is growing poinsettia and making hand-made crafts. She says that there are a lot of handicrafts and souvenirs because the community is very close to a monarch butterfly sanctuary. Braulia is one of the people who year after year oversee the production of poinsettias to adorn house during Christmastime. She is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fertilizers, insecticides and flowerpots since the production begins right now. She has had this business for the past five years and says that she started it to help her husband with household expenses since all their children are in school. She says that she is proud to work with this kind of flower since people from other countries come to her community to buy them and take them back to their countries, and this fills her with happiness because she sees how important her work is. One of her goals is to set up another nursery where she can produce more flowers, and she is saving this year to purchase materials so she will soon be able to do it. The other members of the group are Veronica, Leticia and Berenice, who also plan to use the loan to grow poinsettias.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, insecticides and flowerpots to grow poinsettia.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Samuel has been a farmer. The business has improved with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to start a pig rearing business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into poultry keeping.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in his farm.  He was able to get a harvest, which was very profitable. This enabled him to pay the loan well and in good time.

He plans to use this loan to buy potato and maize seeds for planting, as well as bags of fertilizer in preparation for this planting season.

In the future, Peter hopes to improve his farming methods and expand his farming business; thereby, becoming one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara rents a stall in Sevan city, where she sells household goods and fruit and vegetables as well. Household goods are bought from suppliers, fruits and vegetables are purchased by Tamara from wholesale markets in Yerevan. Tamara intends to diversify her business assortment: she plans to sell fresh fish, especially Sevan trout, at her stall. Therefore Tamara is asking for a 300,000 Armenian drams loan, which will allow her to buy a large lot of fresh fish. Tamara has already had two big aquariums where she will keep the fish. 

42-year-old Tamara lives in Sevan with her family, which consists of her husband, 3 children and her mother-in-law as well. Tamara worked at a flour factory for many years and two years ago she decided to organize her own business. Tamara’s husband helps her at the business and thus they support their family, as the business is the only source of income for them. Tamara’s children attend school, and her mother-in-law is a retiree.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fresh fish

loans.name: Annuciate

texts.en:
Annuciate is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Annuciate has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Annuciate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale, and will help Annuciate to generate greater profits and pay all the expenses at home. Annuciate hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big cosmetic shop for both wholesale and retail. 

Annuciate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annuciate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old and married with four children. To support them, she raises livestock such as chickens and ducks. She sells them to the people in the area and earns P2,000 every month. She is aspiring to earn a higher income, but due to insufficient capital to buy more livestock she can’t attain it. 

So Alma was encouraged to borrow a loan of P7,000 to buy a ducklings, feed and medicines to attain good health. This would then help her to increase her net income and she will save funds for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy a ducklings, feed and medicines

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is married with five children aged between 2 and 17. Two of them are enrolled in school and the other three are still young. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 22 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for rice production and buy seeds.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 27 years old. She did not go to school and lives in Airport with her husband and six children, aged between 1 and 12 years old, four of whom attend school. Her husband works as a community teacher. 

Since 2010 she has been selling palm oil and plantains. She started her business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business. She is proud of her business because she has money in her handbag to use anytime.Her plan is to see her children out of school.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia lives in Airport. She is 19 years old, single, and she is an 11th grade student. She has a one-year-old child. For five years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started her business with 7000 LRD  given to her by her mother. She enjoys how her customers respond to her business and the profit she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Airport. She is 49 years old. She stopped her education in the 6th grade, and  she is a widow with six children between 20 and 30 years old. For the past twenty years she has been selling charcoal. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She  enjoys the profit she receives every day from her business. Her plan is to live  a happy life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en:
Elisee is married with three children between the ages of 7 to 15, and all of them are enrolled in school.  His wife works as a farmer, and he has been a rice farmer for five years.  He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support labor costs

loans.name: Vitalia Margara

texts.es:
Vitalia  es una mujer que tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. Vitalia vive en casa propia en el  distrito de Olmos del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuentan con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 800 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Vitalia es la  venta de prendas de vestir y abarrotes, este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; así mismo también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  y cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su cónyuge es mecánico y lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Vitalia se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (ropas, y abarrotes),  y así mismo su meta es comprar un puesto en el mercado a corto plazo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Vitalia is a 44 year old woman.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in her own home with her children and her partner.  She says that the quality of life in her community is subsistence living.  The majority of the residents are self-employed and make their living in agriculture, ranching and raising small animals.  Some of them also makes livings running stores.  Vitalia lives in her own home in the Olmos District of Lambayeque Department.  She herself has basic electricity, water and sewer services.  She says that in her village about 800 families live under these conditions.
Vitalia's business is selling clothing and groceries.  Her small store is located in her home, where she serves customers whose loyalty she has already earned.  She also makes a living raising poultry and has 6 years of experience, which has allowed her to keep an established clientele in both businesses.  Her husband is a mechanic and she strongly supports him in his business.  The two have a good family relationship.
Currently, Vitalia has decided to expand the inventory of her commercial establishment (her small store), which is very profitable in her area.  So she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles ($575 USD) to be invested in the purchase of merchandise (clothing and groceries).  Vitalia's goal is to purchase a space in the market in the near future, which, in time, will allow her to continue improving her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Patience S.

texts.en: Patience is 30 years old. She stopped her education in the 4th grade and lives in  Airport with her three children between 5 and 12 who are in school. Her husband is a security guard. Since 2003 she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Erica Esmeralda

texts.es:
Erica  es una mujer que tiene 42 años de edad, de estado soltera, vive solo con sus padres lo cual esta al cuidado de ellos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Erica vive en casa propia en el caserío Sipan del distrito de Zaña del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Erica es la venta de Salchipollos y golosinas en la puerta de su casa, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Erica cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo también es profesora nombrada en esa zona, lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
Actualmente Erica se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de salchipollos y golosinas ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de insumos (pollo, aceite, papas, servilletas, lechuga, mayonesa) y golosinas para poder surtir su negocio; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Erica is a 42-year-old woman who is single and lives with her parents in their home so that she can take care of them. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in her community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. Erica's home is in the village of Sipan in the District of Zaña, Department of Lambayeque. The only basic service available in this area is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here live under these conditions.

Erica's business involves selling "salchipollos" (chicken and sausages) and sweets from the doorstep of her house. She has six years of experience in this business. Erica has been able to maintain her customer base and have stability in her business. She also works as a teacher, a job that provides her with additional income.

At the moment, Erica plans to expand her inventory for selling "salchipollos" and sweets since this type of business is very profitable in the area. Under these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN. The money will be used to buy supplies (chicken, oil, potatoes, napkins, lettuce, and mayonnaise) and sweets to restock her business. Over time, this will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Mariscal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR MARISCAL” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Paulina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de aguayos, venta de pescado, venta de kerosenne, venta de verduras, venta de chompas, venta de refrescos, tienda de barrio, venta de salchipapas.

La señora Paulina,  indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de víveres), mismo que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo de lunes a sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda al sustento de su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, específicamente la atención que se da a las mujeres.

En la fotografía aparese la señora Marcela, solo medio cuerpo, ya que no se hubico bien para la imagen.
texts.en:
The "Flor Mariscal" communal bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Los Andes regional office. It is comprised of eleven members and is managed by the board of directors lead by Paulina. The businesses that the communal bank's members manage are diverse, and include  weaving wool, selling fish, selling kerosene, selling vegetables, selling sweaters, selling refreshments, running a neighborhood store, and selling fried potatoes and a hot dog.

Paulina states that she joined the Pro Mujer communal bank one year ago, when she was invited by one of the promoters. Currently, she has a business selling food, which she has worked at for three years. She learned this skill from her mother.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital by buying food, which she will purchase from the markets in the city of El Alto. After preparing the food, she will sell it at her booth Monday through Saturday. This form of work helps her to support her family. She is married and has four children.

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, Paulina said that she likes the area of health; specifically, the attention given to women.

In the photo, one woman, Marcela, is only half shown because she was not well-situated when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: C 7854 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Costasie is 31 years old and married with three children aged between 7 to 10 years. She owns an agriculture business that sells rice, and her business is open from 6 am to 1 pm each week, except for the weekend. Costasie is the leader of a group that is called "C 7854 INTWARI" locally, which means "HERO" in English.  She is the one in the photo with a raised hand. She has four years of experience in this work. 

Costasie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, and renovate her house.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL RADIANTE” iniciará su tercer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mery.
