Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de deportivos, tejido de chompas de alpaca, venta de deportivos, venta de cosméticos, venta de manta de vicuña, venta de comida.

La señora Mery,  indica que hace un  año y medio que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las socias de grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chompas que viene trabajando hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de chompas), mismo que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda al sustento de su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sol Radiante” (Radiant Sun) will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Los Andes.  It is made up of eight members and run by a board of directors headed by Señora Mery.  The members' businesses are varied and include: making sportswear, knitting alpaca sweaters, selling sportswear, selling cosmetics, selling vicuna wool blankets and selling food.

Señora Mery says that she joined the Pro Mujer communal bank a year and a half ago.  She was invited to join by the other members of bank.  She currently has a business selling sweaters, which she has had for the last three years.  She is learning the business from her aunt.
 
The loan that she is taking out is for increasing her capital.  She will purchase sweaters from the city market in Oruro and later take orders to sell them in La Paz.  This work is helping her support her family, as she is a single mother of one son.
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Mery says that she likes the health classes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Liwliwa

texts.en:
Liwliwa is 58 years old and lives with her family. She sells candy and pastries in their village as a source of income.  Some stores love to buy from her, because her pastries are delicious. She needs to maintain her business, so she is seeking a loan amount of P15,000 to buy more candy and pastries to sell. 

She is hoping to greatly improve her business in order to supply all the stores in her village to maximize her profit for her family. She is accompanied by hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: To buy more candy and pastries to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат 48 лет,трудолюбивая,умная женщина,замужем за Миряхё,имеет четверых детей.Дома она с мужем производит национальные,разные сундуки и у них очень много постоянных клиентов по району.Так как она с мужем очень аккуратно и красиво работает, ее товары покупают из дому и ее постоянные клиенты довольны работой Мухаббата.Это профессия осталось им от ее свекра и до сих пор это профессия приносит семье хороший доход.
 За период кредитования Мухаббат расширила свой бизнес и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования а также доказала свою пунктуальность.На очередной займ Мухаббат хочет закупить материалы для производство сундуков. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку и благодарна вам.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 48 years old. She is a hard-working and smart woman. She is married to Miryahe and they have four children. Together, Muhabbat and her husband make various traditional chests at home and have many regular customers in the area. Since they do beautiful, quality work, the goods sell well and customers are happy with the final product. Muhabbat and her husband inherited this craft from his father, and to this day this business brings the family good income.

With previous loans from MDO Arvand, LLC, Muhabbat has expanded her business. She has never violated the conditions of her loans and has demonstrated punctuality with her repayments. Using this new loan, Muhabbat would like to purchase raw materials for the production of the chests. She is hoping for your help and support, and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for production of chests

loans.name: Royer

texts.es:
Royer tiene 24 años, vive en compañía de Yeny, su esposa, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos; Jean Paúl y Ariana. Viven en casa de su suegro, ubicada en la localidad de Panti Pata.  

Él es el único sustento de su familia, se dedica a la siembra de papa, olluco, trigo y demás tubérculos, los cuales realiza en sus terrenos propios y en otros alquilados, pues todavía no se abastece con los que tiene. Su principal ingreso económico es en la época de cosecha, ahí obtiene la recompensa de su esfuerzo. Pero como la siembra no es de todos los días, comenzó en el negocio de compra y venta de animales, los cuales cría para luego venderlos a un precio mayor. Por el momento comenta que trabajará con mucho esmero para poder obtener más capital de trabajo, también sabe que cuando herede los terrenos de su familia le ayudarán a mejorar su economía.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Agu pata” y éste es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, pues obtiene el apoyo económico que necesita.

Royer invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Royer is 24 years old and has lived with his wife Yeny for 5 years.  Together they have 2 children: Jean Paul and Ariana.  They live in his mother-in-law's house, which is located in the town of Panti Pata.

Royer is the only source of support for the family.  He is a farmer who cultivates potatoes, tubers, wheat and other tubers on his own land and on some land that he rents, because he does not own enough land. He earns most of his income during the harvest season, when he finally is rewarded for all of his work.  However, since he is not farming every day, he started a business buying and selling animals that he raises and later sells for a better price.  For now, he says that he will work with a lot of dedication so that he can get more working capital.  In addition, he knows that when he inherits his family's land, this will help him to improve his economic situation.

Royer belongs to the communal bank "Agu Pata," and this is his second loan with MFP, where he feels that he's developing because he is getting the financial support that he needs.

Royer will invest this loan in the purchase of animals so that he can have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Las Amapolas Group

texts.es: Aida tiene 48 años, ella desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de banquetes para eventos especiales como quince años, bodas, fiestas infantiles, cumpleaños etc. Dice que empezó con este negocio ya que ella estudio un curso de cocina y su familia le decía que cocinaba muy sabroso y es por eso que ella decidió hacer su propio negocio y aparte que también dijo que antes no había tanta competencia. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de mantelería ya que también renta manteles y loza para servir la comida. Ella comprara también loza,  charolas para servir sus platillos e insumos para hacer la comida.  Dice que este trabajo que tiene es lo que más le apasiona ya que disfruta mucho su trabajo que es el hacer sus comidas sabrosas. Los insumos que ocupa los compra en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro en diferentes puestos donde le dan precios bajos. La meta de doña Aida es hacer un salón para eventos para poder rentar todo lo que se necesita hacer una fiesta. Los otros 10 integrantes del grupo se llaman Angelina, Leticia, María Francisca, María del Carmen, María del Carmen E., Marco Alejandro, María Guadalupe, Antonia, Margarita y Adriana ellos invertirán sus créditos en insumos para hacer y vender antojitos mexicanos, en productos para un club nutricional, en artículos  e insumos para cooperativa escolar, en maquinas para hacer tortillas, colchas por catalogo, ropa para dama y frutas para jugueria.
texts.en: Aida is 48 years old.  For over 10 years she had made her living preparing banquet feasts for special events like, 15th birthday celebrations, weddings, children's parties, birthdays etc.  She says she started this business because she completed a cooking course and because her family always told her that her cooking was delicious.  So she decided to start a business, and besides, there wasn't much competition back then.  Aida is requesting the financing in order to purchase table linens and china for the food service, both of which she rents out.   She will also purchase china, trays for serving the plates of food and food-making supplies.  She says she feels passionate about her work, as she really enjoys preparing delicious food.  She purchases the supplies that she uses in the Zitacuaro wholesale food market, going to different sellers the find the best prices.  Doña Aida's goal is to have a banquet hall to be able to rent out everything someone would need for a party.  The other 10 members of the communal bank are Angelina, Leticia, María Francisca, María del Carmen, María del Carmen E., Marco Alejandro, María Guadalupe, Antonia, Margarita and Adriana.  They will invest their loans in supplies for making and selling Mexican snacks, in products for a nutritional club, in articles and supplies for a schooling cooperative, in tortilla-making machines, in catalog bedspreads, in women's clothing and in fruit for a juice bar.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making food, table linens and china.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is married with four children aged between 2 and 15. Two of them are enrolled in school, while the others are not, because they are still young. His wife works as a farmer, and he has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area that he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and buy seeds for rice farming

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Maria  de 33 años de edad,  vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 7 a 17 años de edad. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada mediante una oferta  que hace a través de catálogos o guías especializadas, con las que Maria siempre trabaja. Su primer fue de $300.000 COP,  capital lo obtuvo de manos de su cónyuge y lo invirtió en materias primas e insumos y herramientas para trabajar en el mejoramiento de la imagen de las personas, con ello fue creciendo poco a poco y agregó productos por catálogos asociados  a su actividad, con los que le ha ido muy bien, porque presta servicios de belleza a domicilio y también asesora y vende productos cosméticos a crédito, en este mismo mercado, que le refiere nuevos compradores, siendo su mayor desafío ante la potencial clientela, el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos para su trabajo de belleza y cosméticos para la venta. La razón de éxito de su inversión es que tendrá la capacidad de tener un fondo para financiar su cartera de crédito y responderle a su nueva clientela.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and three children who are between the ages of 7 and 17. There she sells merchandise offered through catalogs and specialty guides that she always has available. Her initial seed capital was 300,000 COP, which she obtained from the hands of her husband. She invested the money in materials, supplies, and equipment for her work of improving people's images. Her business grew gradually and she added products from related catalogs. She has done very well because she provides beauty services from her home. Maria is also an image consultant and sells cosmetic products on credit.

In this business that relies on referrals in order to gain new clients, her greatest challenge is the lack of capital for attracting potential customers. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy beauty supplies for her work and cosmetics to sell. The reason why her investment will be successful is that she now has a line of credit that will enable her to respond to new customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Purificaciòn

texts.es:
Purificación es un hombre que tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia con sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Purificación vive en casa propia en el caserío Punto Nueve del distrito de Mochumi del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo  cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Purificación es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral  y caprinos , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Purificación cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo sus padres le apoyan en este tipo de negocio, donde poseen una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Purificación se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde, vitaminas y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Purificación is a single, 22-year-old-man. He lives in his own home with his parents. He says that the quality of life in his community is based on subsistence. The majority of inhabitants are independent workers who make a living by raising and selling smaller animals and some of them also work in agriculture. Purificación lives in his own home in the small village of Punto Nuevo in the Mochumi district, which is in the department of Lambayeque. He also depends on basic electric service and water which comes from an artesian well. All of the families settled here live under these conditions.

Purificación makes a living through the business of trading, raising, fattening, and selling smaller animals such as birds for poultry, sheep, and goats. He raises these animals in outdoor pens by his home. However, he mentions that he sells these animals at the local market and/or to wholesale buyers of animals. Purificación notes that he has two years experience with this work, which has allowed him to maintain customers and establish himself in the business. His parents also support him in this business, and they have a good family relationship.

Currently, Purificación is attempting to increase his inventory for the trade, fattening and sale of animals such as pigs, sheep and goats, and birds for poultry. He is doing this because it is a profitable business in the area. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan of 1000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This loan will be used to buy animal feed, vitamins, and to repair his animal pens. In time, this will allow him to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins, and to repair his animal pens

loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengo is a 36-year-old businessman in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married and a father of three children.  He sells water to the residents of Mshomoroni. He also owns rental houses, which supplement his income.

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a water tank. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate his rental houses. 

He hopes to have a well-established business, which will enable him educate his children to a college-level.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Neonila

texts.ru:
Неонила вдова. У нее две взрослые дочки. Неонила имеет собственный бизнес.

Неонила занимается выездной торговлей. Она продает женские брюки на протяжении 12 лет. Неонила отличается стабильностью. Она умеет выбирать правильный товар и у нее есть постоянные клиенты. Неониле нравится это направление. Она трудолюбивая и настойчивая. Бизнес цель Неонилы: открыть свой магазин.

Неонила просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку 40 пар брюк для весеннего сезона. Кредит поможет ей увеличить ассортимент, а тем самым увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Neonila is a widow and has two adult daughters. She has had her own business for the past 12 years - she travels, selling women's trousers. Neonila's key quality is stability. She is always able to select appropriate fashions, and has many regular customers. She enjoys her occupation, and is hard-working and persistent. Her business objective is to open her own store.

Neonila is requesting a loan of 15000 hryvnia to purchase 40 pairs of trousers for the spring season. This loan will allow her to expand the assortment of her merchandise, and thereby increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pairs of trousers for the spring season

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is married with four children aged between three and nine years. Two of them are enrolled in school.

Innocent has been a rice farmer for fifteen years; his wife also works farming rice. He is requesting a 430,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy seed and cover labor costs to get the best harvest possible. With the profits, he plans to expand his fields to get a bigger yield.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seed and cover labor costs for his farm.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena, 48 raises hogs as a source of income. She sells them after four or five months, earning about 2,000 PHP for each hog she sells.

Nena would like to make her business more profitable, so she is asking for a 5,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy more feed, medicine and vitamins for her hogs. She would like to keep her business profitable so as to afford the best education for her two children. She believes this is the best thing they could inherit from her.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Eugina

texts.en:
Eugina, 33 years old, is a high school graduate. She lives in Airport, Liberia with her three children between five and 14 years of age who all attend school.

For the past eight years Eugina has sold slippers and lappas (traditional long skirts tied at the waist) in the local market. She started her business with money given to her by mother. She enjoys making a profit every day.

Eugina is requesting a 18,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more slippers and lappas to sell. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and lappas to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina   es una mujer que tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil Viuda, vive con un hijo mayor de edad en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Martina vive en casa propia en el caserío Los Bances del distrito de Túcume del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Martina es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales vacunos asi como animales menores como: aves de corral ,porcinos, caprinos y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Martina cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su hijo le apoya en su parcela donde tiene instalado 1.0 ha de Maíz amarillo duro, donde presenta buen aspecto fitosanitario.
Actualmente Martina se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (vacunos, porcinos, ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde, y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is a 58-year-old who is widowed and lives in her own home with her grown son. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in her community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. Martina's home is in the village of Los Bances in the District of Túcume, Department of Lambayeque. The only basic service available in this area is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here live under these conditions.

Martina's business involves trading, raising, fattening, and selling animals. These include cattle and small animals such as poultry, pigs, goats, and sheep. The animals are kept in pens outside of her home. Martina sells her animals at the local market or to wholesale livestock traders. She has gained 20 years of experience in this business, which has enabled her to maintain an established clientele. Her son helps her by maintaining her land, which consists of one hectare of yellow corn. He is able to produce a healthy crop.

At the moment, Martina proposes to expand the inventory for her business of fattening and selling animals (including cattle, pigs, sheep, goats, and chickens) since this type of business is very profitable in her area. Under these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 PEN. The money will be used to buy balanced feed for fattening the animals and fertilizers for her crops. Over time, she will able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening animals and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria  es una mujer que tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su hijo y su cónyuge en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Victoria vive en casa propia en el caserío San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo  cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Victoria es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral  y Ovinos , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Victoria cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge tiene instalado 4.0 has de plantación de mango y limón donde viene cosechando y también le apoya económicamente, donde poseen una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Victoria se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (ovinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde,  y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman who is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her son and her husband in their own house. It is said that the quality of life in the community is subsistence level. The majority of the residents are independent workers who work in selling and raising small animals, and some of them also work in agriculture. Victoria lives in her own house in the village of San Martín in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. She has basic electrical service and water is provided by an artesian well. All the families who live in this area also live in these conditions.

Victoria's work is the business of raising, fattening, and selling small animals such as barnyard fowl and sheep. She raises the animals in pens outside her home. Nevertheless, she sells them in the local market and/or to wholesale buyers of animals. It should be emphasized that Victoria has 10 years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain her customers since she is already established in this business. In addition, her husband has planted four hectares with mangoes and lemons which he harvests, and he also supports her financially, where they have a good family relationship.

Now Victoria has proposed increasing her inventory with regard to commercializing, fattening, and selling animals (sheep and barnyard fowl), since this is a very profitable business in this area. It is because of these circumstances that she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN, which will be destined for the purchase of balanced feed to fatten her animals and for the purchase of fertilizer for their crops, which in time will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is a 33-year-old widow who lives in Airport with two children, ages 6 and 11. While she did not go to school, the children are in school.

Since 2006, she's sold peanuts, bananas, oranges and cookies in her community. She's requesting a loan to purchase more bananas, oranges, peanuts, flour, butter and sugar for her business. She enjoys the profit she makes from her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, peanuts, flour, butter and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle, buy a car radio and speakers, and pay school expenses.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha, 23, lives in Buchanan. She is a single mother of two children, ages 6 and four months, with the older one in school. For the past four years, she has been selling slippers in the local market. She established the business with small loans from friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Yesero

texts.en: Yesero, 37, is married with four children and lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has been trading cattle for quite a long time. He faces price fluctuations and inadequate capital challenges. His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to buy land in the future for crop farming.Yesero intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old single man. For the past three years, he has been raising and selling dairy products, which has been profitable and his only source of income. He needs more financial support to cover the costs and the increasing demand from customers.

Hassan is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him purchase bulk fodder to feed the cows he is raising. This will increase the amount of milk, which will increase sales and improve Hassan's income.

Hassan is photographed holding a container of milk.



About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase bulk fodder to feed cows.

loans.name: Amanecer (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  amanecer y se integra de cuatro señoras quienes viven un pueblo  llamado coapilla, en donde celebran la fiesta de la virgen de Candelaria el 2 de febrero.

   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Magdalena, ella es  casada con el señor Bulmaro con quien procreo tres hijos quienes dos ya están casado y uno a un está a su responsabilidad en tercero  de secundaria.

   Doña magdalena  solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: maíz, aceite, pasas, carne, hoja de guineo  para la elaboración de tamales en donde lleva de trabajando  dos años cuatro meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha logrado  mejorar un poco  mas sus ingresos.
    
     Se dedica a esta  actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa  así también  apoyar a su  hijos con sus gastos de sus útiles escolares y así estar bien como familia y con lo  que le queda guarda para tener su pago puntual en el grupo.

   Lo que desea es que la sigan apoyando para así  seguir adelante con su actividad y con el tiempo tener otra actividad para seguir.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Brígida quien invertir su  actividad en productos medicinales,  la señora Candelaria invertirá el préstamo e la compra de maíz para posteriormente venderlo y la señora Zoraida invertirá en la compra de productos medicinales.
texts.en:
The group called "Amanecer" (Dawn) consists of four women who live in the town of Coapilla. The Festival of the Virgin of Candelaria is celebrated here on February 2.

Magdalena was the person selected to be interviewed. She is married to Sr. Bulmaro and they have three children. Two of them are already married and the other one, who is still under her responsibility, is in the third year of high school.

Doña Magdalena is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of ingredients such as corn, oil, raisins, meat, and banana leaves for making tamales. She has been working for two years and four months and says that she has done very well. This has enabled her to make a slight improvement in her income. Magdalena engages in this business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She is also able to help with her children's expenses, such as school supplies. After she provides for the welfare of her family, she has enough left over to submit the loan payments in her group on time. She wants to continue receiving assistance so that she can move forward in her business. Over time, she would like to pursue another business.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Brigida will invest in her business of selling medicinal products. • Sra. Candelaria will invest her loan in the purchase of corn for eventual resale. • Sra. Zoraida will invest in the purchase of medicinal products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales.

loans.name: Cabecera Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cabecera” está conformado por nueve mujeres todas son muy trabajadoras y responsables ellas viven en una comunidad llamada cabecera un lugar muy pequeño y tranquilo por el lugar donde viven es así que le pusieron a su grupo, Doña Guadalupe quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 43 años de edad está casada con el señor Raimundo desde hace 23 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos que dos ya asisten a la escuela  el más pequeño aun no. Ella se dedica a la venta de colchas edredones, sabanas, cortinas, con el crédito que ha solicitado comprara de todo, doña Lupita como la conocen en el pueblo tiene un tienda  en Tula Hidalgo ahí tiene un empleado quien le ayuda para atender su tienda, esta actividad la inicio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, el reto más grande que presenta doña Lupita es que no puede estar allá tanto tiempo y dejar a su familia, también le preocupa cuando no hay ganancias porque las personas buscan mejor calidad y mejor precio, pero ella confía en que el crédito le ayudara para surtirse mejor y sus ganancias aumenten, porque con sus ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus articulas sacaba para pagar el crédito para la comida, ropa y educación de sus hijos, con su actividad está un poco más tranquila porque tiene para solventar los gastos de sus hogar, la meta de la señora Lupita es hacer más grande su negocio pero más que nada que todos sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera y se superen profesionalmente,  Doña Guadalupe están muy agradecidas con FRAC y Kiva ya que podrán comprar lo que les haga falta en sus actividades para aumentar sus ganancias, Ángela, Diana, Blanca, Benita, Elizabeth, compraran borregos, Victoria  invertirá en ropa para su venta, Benita comprara maíz para la elaboración de sus tortillas, y Julia iniciara con sus negocio de Bisutería.
texts.en:
The group "Cabecera" is made up of 9 women who are all very hardworking and responsible. They live in a community called Cabecera, a very small and tranquil place that gave the group their name. 

Guadalupe, the group's representative, is 43 and married to Raimundo. They've been together for 23 years and have formed a family with three children, two of whom are already in school while the youngest is not. Guadalupe sells down comforters, sheets and curtains. With the loan requested she will buy some of all of those. Lupita, as she's known in her town, has a store in Tula Hidalgo, and has one employee that helps her to tend to the store. She started her business to help her husband with their household expenses. Her biggest challenge is not being able to be there all the time and leaving her family while she works. She also worries when she doesn't make profits because people are looking for better quality and better prices, but she is confident that the loan will help her to stock her store better and increase her earnings. This business has made her a little calmer because she can cover the costs of her home. 

Lupita's goal is to make her business bigger, but above all to see all of her children get a degree and succeed professionally. Guadalupe and the other women are very grateful to FRAC and Kiva because now they will be able to buy what they lack in their businesses to increase profits. Angela, Diana, Blanca, Benita and Elizabeth will buy sheep; Victoria will buy clothing for resale; Benita will buy corn to make tortillas; and Julia will start a jewelry business.

loans.use: to buy down comforters.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es: Antonia de 45 años de edad, dedicada al comercio ya hace varios años iniciando su negocio con micro-creditos que la institucion le ha otorgado. En esta ocasión quiere este prestamo para rein-vertirlo en su negocio de gorras, fajas, calzado entre otros productos logrando de esta forma mejores ventas al ofrecer mas variedad de producto. Expresa sentirse muy contenta por tener su propio tramo en uno de los mercados de la capital ya que no se asolea y ni se moja al tener un lugar fijo. Para ella es muy importante el serle de apoyo a su señor esposo ya que el teniendo como oficio el ser vigilante no les da sus ingresos para cubrir con la totalidad de los gastos del hogar por lo que agradece a la micro-financiera por hacerla parte de la gran familia de Afodenic y kiva y a su vez ayudar a que su negocio dia a dia crezca.
texts.en: Antonia, who is 45 years old, works in commerce, since she set up her business several years ago with micro-loans that the institution granted her. At this time she wants a loan to reinvest in her business of caps, belts, and footwear, among other products, so that in this way she will achieve better sales by offering a greater variety of products. She says that she feels very happy to have her own section in one of the markets in the capital, since by having a regular spot she is not out in the sun and doesn't get wet. For her it is very important to help her husband, since his having job as a watchman doesn't give sufficient income to cover all the household expenses, and for this reason she is thankful to micro-financing for making her part of the great family of Afodenic and Kiva and in turn for helping her business grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy various items to stock her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth T.

texts.en: Elizabeth, aged 25, lives in Airport.  She is a high school graduate and has two children, aged five months and five years, with the oldest one in school. For two years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She likes the way that her customers respond to her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi, aged 23, is married and is a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the past two years and is doing well. 

This is his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent. Hamisi will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business.

He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, 45, lives in Buchanan, and is married with five children between the ages of 15 and 30. She sells shoes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her aunt. She enjoys the money earned from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes, sneakers, and used slippers for her business. Sarah hopes to improve her children's education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, sneakers, and used slippers for her business.

loans.name: Powermah

texts.en: Powermah, 35, lives in Buchanan and is married with six children between the ages of 4 and 17. She has a 4th grade education and runs a cook shop (restaurant). She started this business with money given to her by her sister. She enjoys the money she earns from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food and other goods (rice, oil, charcoal, vita [juice drink], pepper, fish, and meat) for her business. She wants to have her own house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more food and other goods (rice, oil, charcoal, vita, pepper, fish, and meat) for her business

loans.name: Heizel Joy

texts.en: Heizel Joy, aged 23, operates a hog fattening business as her main source of income. She had been in her business for five years and usually earns PHP 2,000 each month. She still wants to improve her sales for the welfare of her two children.  Heizel Joy is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. With continuous hard work and profits from her business, she will someday achieve a good life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a 26-year-old single man. For the past four years, he has operated a cafe where he provides his customers with soft drinks and hot drinks, snacks and sandwiches. His cafe is characterized by its location which is near a local university where there is good movement all day. The cafe has been a profitable project for Sameh but he also needs more support to cover the costs. 

Sameh wants to improve the condition of the cafe's internal yard so it can become part of the cafe. The purpose is to expand the space especially as the number of customers increase in the summer season. Sameh is therefore requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new external umbrellas, chairs and tables, and new serving equipment. This will expand the cafe and improve its conditions, which will lead to satisfied customers and help to increase sales and improve Sameh's income.

Sameh is photographed inside the cafe.

loans.use: To buy new external umbrellas, chairs and tables, and serving equipment

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las estrellitas y se integra de  cinco señora quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad  y vive en un barrio llamado Colosio.
 
  Quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama  María Jesús tiene treinta y un años de edad, vive en unión libre con el señor  José Omar con quien procreo tres hijo que aun están a su  responsabilidad  y estudian en preescolar y primaria.

   Ella es la primera vez que se integra en el grupo  y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración  de comidas para vender en la secundaria en donde lleva trabajando  dos años en la que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ella a logrado genera más ingresos en su hogar.

    Se  inspiro en esta actividad para apoyara a su esposo con sus ingresos  y así darle lo mas necesario  a su familia y logren seguir adelante mientras dios les preste vida.

    Lo que desea es que en esta actividad ella siga trabajado  para así agrandar un poco mas su negocio ya que  en donde vende está un poco  informal.

    Las personas que integran en el grupo son: la señora Irma , quien invertirá e préstamo en la compra de  productos agrícolas, como  café molido , tascalate, y polvillo , Matilde  invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de trastes,  Flor de María invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de alimentos  para la crianza de pollos de rancho y la señora Martha invertirá en la  compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas.
texts.en:
The group known as "Las Estrellitas" is made up of 5 women who all live in a neighborhood called Colosio and run different businesses.

The interviewee was Maria Jesus. She is 31, married to Jose Omar, and they have three children who are in preschool and elementary school. This is her first time as a member of the group, and she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make meals to sell at the high school where she has been working for two years. She says that it's going well because with her work she has made more money for their household. She was inspired to to this work to support her husband with their income and give her family the things that they need so that they can keep moving forward for as long as God gives them life.

What she wants most is to keep working so that she can expand her business a little, because right now where she sells is sort of informal.

The group members are: Irma, who will buy agricultural products like ground coffee, tascalate [a chocolate drink blend] and animal feed made of rice bran; Matilde will invest in dishes for resale; Flor de Maria will buy chicken feed; and Martha will purchase ingredients to make meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, aged 35, is from Ndunyu and is married with three children who are all in school.

She is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy two bags of fertilizers and seedlings to plant. The place where Lucy lives is a fairly wet area rich in agricultural activities with a ready market from middlemen who sell to other towns.

She hopes to expand her farming and boost her income in the near future, which will help her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Josè Adriano

texts.es:
José  es un hombre que tiene 24 años de edad, de estado soltero, vive solo con sus padres lo cual esta al cuidado de ellos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. José  vive en casa propia en el caserío Santa Elena del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura, así mismo no cuenta con los servicios básicos de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura pues tiene 1.0 ha. De terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón que presenta buen crecimiento vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 03 años que le ha permitido tener  experiencia,y asi mismo mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo también su padre firma como aval en los créditos otorgados por Edpyme Alternativa.
Actualmente José se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechada ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de fertilizantes, y pago de jornales para su cultivo instalado; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 24-year-old gentleman who is single and lives with his parents in their home so that he can take care of them. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in his community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. José's home is located in the village of Santa Elena in the District of Tambogrande, Department of Piura. This area does not receive electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here must live under these conditions.

José is a farmer who has one hectare of land that he inherited from his father. He has planted lemons and this crop has developed well. José is able to harvest fruit on a weekly basis and sells his produce at the local market. He has been in this business for three years and it has enabled him to gain experience. José has maintained his customer base now that his business is established. His father also acts as the guarantor of the loans he has received from Edpyme Alternativa.

At the moment, José proposes to expand his inventory for selling his harvested crops since this type of business is very profitable in his area. Under these circumstances, he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN. The money will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay his workers. Over time, this will help him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the wages of his workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of groceries to expand his business
